description:
We were driving home and all of a sudden craved some milk tea/boba. I was yelping as we were driving along and decided to go with this one out of alllll the wayyy tooo many options. 

We were pleasantly surprised! The first thing I saw on their wall outside was the strawberry milk which looked yummy and refreshing. Luckily when I asked about caffeine, it didn't have any. YAHHOO! (No caffeine for me after a certain time). Then a quick browse showed Yes! They do have cheese foam which my husband loves.

Two drinks for 10.81 with tax! WHOA! definitely on the pricier side. The guy who took the order was fast, no frills, but after ordering I worried about the sweetness/ice/toppings etc because he didn't ask if I wanted anything! But luckily my strawberry milk DID come with the boba and pudding like the pictures and it was exactly what I wanted! He also enjoyed his sea salt cheese foam!

So for the two that we had, we definitely enjoyed it, although a little pricier than other places. We might be back!
author: Christine M.

description:
It's great that there are a ton of options, but unfortunately the flavors are not strong enough for me. I was once a fan of the wide cups (actually I think that's why I came here at first!), but they become quite a hassle to bring into any car... I have yet to see a huge cup holder!

I most recently ordered the taro milk tea, but could not taste the taro at all. I actually thought I may have been given someone else's drink (a regular milk tea perhaps?) but was personally handed the drink so I don't think that was it... was just lacking in flavor. 

$10 card minimum is kind of annoying! It seems like most places are getting rid of this altogether or at least setting the minimum to a more reasonable $5.
author: Maayan C.

description:
Great tea
Excellent services 
Love their oolong tea
Do not like the parking, no place to park. That is just typical San Francisco.
author: Ann W.

description:
The boba tea here was really good! I got the Taiwan brown sugar iced milk drink with red bean and honey boba (C8, $4.98), and it was surprisingly delicious. First of all, it comes in a wide cup. The drink itself is pretty sweet and you can definitely taste the honey and sugar. They have a generous amount of red bean and boba. I would definitely come back to have this. 

Service was fast and they had a nice little seating area. Bring cash if your order is under $10, and check in for 10% off on Yelp!
author: Amy C.

description: If you're looking for delicious boba that is not overly sweet and made fresh to order, come to Honey B! I ordered the red bean milk tea with boba and it was YUMS! The drink takes a while to make but completely understandable since they brew the tea fresh. I'm excited to try other drinks on their menu!
author: Katherine N.

description: This place has delicious boba milk tea. I really enjoyed the Honey pudding milk tea. It's a cool little place to hangout.
author: Juan V.

description: Used to come here more often when I live in the city. Their drinks are good and their prices are really affordable. Their milk teas are one of my favorites ans when it comes to the boba, I really liked the texture. Customer service is decent, never rushed or anything.
author: Shaeli Z.

description:
In the US, Honey B Tea House is hot. I've never been to Taiwan, but I think this would be an average boba joint. That said, I still think this place deserves 4 stars just for being more than basic and, more importantly, serving up some good drinks which includes cremas! They have a huge menu and the employees were quick to take my order and make it.

Definitely not a bad choice to satisfy a tapioca drink craving!
author: Marlon T.

description:
Came here recently for my standard milk tea. I like the chubby cups and the sealed lid as opposed to the plastic top many are now employing.

The taste however was underwhelming and the boba also tasted old and not very fresh. I have them at a 4 (out of 10) for milk tea taste and a 3 (out of 10) for boba taste. 

That puts Honey B at #47  of 54 SF boba spots currently. 

Rod M tours San Francisco area in search of the BEST standard milk tea with boba. I have individual reviews for all the places listed below.  I have a more comprehensive Tiered Bay Area boba list 124 boba spots and counting. 

I recently embarked on a completely pointless quest to rank most of the Milk Tea/Boba Places in the area.

Rules: I ordered a simple milk tea with Boba (regular sweetness, ice etc.)

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top)  is my favorite/ #51  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. 

Rod Boba SF Rating = (Taste of Milk Tea / Taste of Tapioca Balls) on a Scale of 1 to 10 (10/10) being the best score possible

* Please note that I like my boba a little bit sweet. I don't like it too milky, too strong of a tea taste or too watery.  I prefer fresh tasting larger "boba".  Powdery drinks (those places that simply have a plastic carafe that they pour out of ) and boba that tastes "old" get docked on my rating scale.  A place could have a higher Yelp rating than it's boba score would imply , if it sells things other than Boba that are good. 

SF/Daly City Rankings:
1 Itea  2 Caffe Central  3 Cool Tea   4 The Boba Shop  5 Little Sweet  6 Good Earth Café  7 Hanlin Tea  8 Puppy bobar  9 Keep it  10 Wondertea  11 Enter the Café  12 Urban Ritual  13 Tpumps  14 The Ramen Bar  15 Eightea  16 Super Cue  17 Bliss Sweet  18 Enter the Café  19 BB Tea Station  20 Qualitea  21 Steap (not Steep)  22 Bubblecup  23 Tea Hut  24 Sharetea  25 Tanca  26 Boba Guys  27 Steep (not Steap)  28 Mr. & Mrs. Tea House  29 T&T Café  30 Pit Stop Boba Shop  31 Bobo Drinks & Pho  32 Samovar Tea  33 5 sweets  34 TJ Cups  35 Asha Tea House  36 E Tea  37 Kestourine Macarons  38 Little Heaven Deli  39 Maggies Café  40 Belly Good Café & Crepes  41 Tea Bear  42 Sweet Heart Café  43 Honeycreme  44 Elixiria  45 Quickly  46 Plentea  47 Honey B Tea House  48 Sweethut  49 Mi-tea  50 Ten Ren Tea  51 Wonderful Foods/Dessert & Café  52 Out the Door  53 I Café  54 Phusion                                                   
Just a little taste of my greater Bay Area Tiers is below (there are 6 tiers I have in total, I've reviewed over 124 + boba spots now but obviously not enough room to list them all here) 

124 boba spots and counting in the Bay Area (yes you read that correctly one hundred and twenty four ...) 
Rod's SF Bay Area Boba Tiers: This is based on my milk tea taste/ boba taste rating scale with 10/10 being the absolute best.  I have actual ranked lists for the South 880 corridor and San Francisco in case you're wondering. 
Tier 1 (Alphabetized) "Magnificent 4" aka "I'll get some even if I shouldn't..."
Bubbly, I-Tea, Pekoe, Teatop

Tier 2 : (Alphabetized) "The Almost Elite..but not quite" aka " I'm a fan but not a die hard" 
Caffe Central, Cool Tea, Factory Tea Bar, Good Earth Café,  Gong Cha, Hanlin Tea, Little Sweet, Passion  T snacks and Desserts, Soyful Desserts,  Tea Station ,The Boba Shop, U Cha 

Tier 3 (Alphabetized)  "The Above average spots" aka " Sure why not..let's roll" : 85 Degree, BlackBall Desserts, Bliss Sweet, Bobapia, Cha Express, Che-Lo, Keep it,Puppy Bobar, Qualitea,  Super Cue, T4, Tastea, Tata Tea,Tea Breeze,  Tea Island, Tea Six,  Tea Station, Teaspoon, Teatime, The Ramen Bar, T-Lab, Tpumps,Urban Ritual, Wondertea
author: Rod M.

description:
I came here for a drink wth a friend while we were waiting for our reservations at PPQ. This place had a wide selection of drinks and it was difficult for me to decide what to get. But luckily they had a top drinks section, which helped a lot. 

I ordered the hot grass jelly, and you have the choice of choosing two toppings from the list (honey boba, red bean, mung bean, and taro). I ended up choosing honey boba and red bean. I actually really enjoyed the drink. However, they used a long cup for the drink so all the toppings actually got stuck on the bottom, which made it a bit difficult to drink/eat it evenly. Since all the toppings got stuck on the bottom, the red bean plus honey boba actually made it way too sweet towards the end. 

I'm not sure if this place is under staffed, but the service was a bit on the slower end compared to other boba places. Even when I was trying to order, the staff was too busy preparing drinks that it took him a while before he took my order. Once I ordered, it also took a while before my drink came. 

Overall it's still a decent place but not anything special compared to a lot of other boba shops.
author: Nina W.

description:
A very extensive drink menu compared to other boba places, and this store has a snack menu too which is a bonus. 

I tried there osmanthus milk tea and garlic fries. I did taste the osmanthus in the milk tea, but the milk tea base taste very generic, lacking tea flavor and has a strong coffeemate/ creamer flavor for the milk portion. Garlic fries was freshly made, hot and crispy. It was sprinkled with some garlic dices and finely chopped green herbs (possibly basil) However, the whole tray of garlic fries was drenched with salt. It is probably sea salt since there are a lot of big white salt crystal in the fries. Way too salty. 

Clean interior and reasonable parking around this area. With the mediocre drink and snacks, it is worth a try if you are around the area and craving boba.
author: Karen C.

description: This place is not my first choice, but this was the only place that was open in outer Richmond that I knew made egg puffs. They were under down and tasted floury. I'd prefer Eggettes over Honey B any day.
author: Angie Y.

description:
It's next to a movie theater we went so we rested to have some snacks.

They offer a great variety of bubble teas, hot drinks and smoothies. Basically they have whatever you'd name it. I got the brown sugar ginger hot tea, it was a bit too sweet when I drink over a half of it.

Snacks were pretty good, especially the fried chicken and wings, the fish eggs were a bit cold when they were served, but tasted good.
author: Xuaner Z.

description:
OMG they have sea salt cheese tea cream here!!! I tried a tiramisu form of this drink back in Rowland Heights (Tancca) and was craving this form of boba, so you can only imagine my excitement when I saw this option here. The full list of items I got:

- sea salt cheese tea cream, no toppings - As an afterthought, I should've gotten pudding, but this drink was still good. The layer of cheese was thin, but the overall amount of it was a good balance. The tea itself was nicely flavorful in a bitter way, so the sea salt cheese was the perfect compliment.
- milk tea with boba - The boba was really hard, but the tea was good! Just what you'd expect a good milk tea to taste like.
- popcorn chicken - Really plain and not as crispy as i would have liked, but acceptable. I wish there was basil as well. There was no seasoning on it or sauce (e.g. sweet and sour) for it originally. If you're taking it to go, there is either salt & pepper seasoning or the red pepper powder. I covered it up in the latter - spicy is the way to go! 
- garlic fries - More like salt with a side of fries... There was no garlic taste, just a super salty flavor to this order.

The parking at around 5pm on a weekday wasn't bad. I would come here again to try other food and drinks!
author: Joan Y.

description:
After a day out in SF, my friends and I decided to come here since one of them absolutely loves this place. Parking can be tricky but it's a suburban area so we found one quick. There's a movie theater across the street and a burger joint down the street so there was plenty of stores around. 

The store is actually pretty spacious and brightly decorated. I ordered the guava green tea while my friends got rose milk tea, taro and caramel. All of our drinks came out really good, and I loved my guava green tea. It was refreshing and not too sweet. The rose milk tea was not too fragrant (or else it'd taste like I'm drinking perfume!!) and I liked the real taro bits in my friends taro drink. 

Docking a star because the drinks were pricey (imo), the drinks were pretty decently made and not too sweet at all.
author: Jenny H.

description:
Stopped by this place on a whim just before closing to get some tea on a cold night and some snacks! 

I had a hot matcha green milk tea and shared some sweet potato fries with my sister. I loved them both! The tea was strong and the fries were perfectly crispy and sprinkled with cheese(?) to add more flavor. My cousins ordered some chicken and a red bean egg puff and those were super delicious as well. 

TLDR: Consider a snack with your drink because they surely know what they're doing!
author: Jennifer T.

description:
Before I start my review, they do have many options including many caffeine-free options which is great because several in have to medically stay away from caffeine.
So it is possible we just ordered the wrong thing.

So Anyway, we asked for the chocolate iced milk and apparently we didnt read the menu close enough because it was basically a carmely-brown sugar drink with some chocolate flavored pudding floating around in it. I had expected chocolate flavored ice milk like i've had at other places. My mistake. 
It wasn't bad though, i liked it, it was just different which is reflected in the following rankings. 

[we did a boba run through the richmond on 7.7.18. here are the results and rankings for honey b]

all the following categories (boba texture/freshness/flavor) are scored out of five and their position in to the seven total places we visited is listed also
person a 2/2/2/6 #7
person b 2/2/2/6 #7
person c 4/4/4/12 #6
person d 4/3/3/10 #5
author: Boba R.

description:
Honey B Tea House is in the mold of the Quickly stops...a variety of tea and boba drink selections paired with some savory deep fried snacks.  

We stopped by and found a clean storefront and an easy to read menu.  Our orders:

Durian Milk Tea - made with a mixture of ice, boba and milk topping.  Disappointing in that the durian flavor was very mild and almost absent.  Which is a shame, because if you're going to do something like order durian, the least you deserve is the strong smell and taste.

Popcorn Chicken - $4.95.  A Chinese takeout box is filled with small pieces of tender and mainly dark meat chicken.  Everything is fairly tasty and they're cooked hot, but neither very crispy nor particularly juicy.  It's similar to the Quickly orders and most likely has to do with chicken quality and selection.

Overall, basic stop with the standard drink and snack options.  Service is fine and the place is clean, but nothing particularly memorable.
author: Randy F.

description: Ordered a Thai tea with boba. The Thai tea itself was not bad, but I have mixed feeling about the boba. It had a good chewy texture but tasted super bland. A drink + 1 topping comes out to $5, which isn't cheap. Overall, I wasn't impressed but it was still enjoyable.  Check in on Yelp for 10% off!
author: Brian G.

description:
I ordered the Strawberry Basil Green tea with aloe and no ice. 

They charged me extra for no ice. I always request no ice whenever I order boba anywhere I go and this was the first time I was charged for it. This makes me question how much drink they actually give you with ice. 

Also, the 10% Yelp check in discount doesn't apply to custom orders. 

The cashier told me none of this as my friends and I put in our order. This only came to my attention after I saw my receipt and I had to question her. 

The drink itself was okay but that alone is not enough to make me want to come back. The customer service or lack thereof left a bad taste and I will definitely not be returning.
author: Kit K.

description:
NOTE: $10 MIN ON CREDIT OR $0.50 ADDITIONAL FEE

Although Honey B never autofills when you search for it on Google Maps, it has definitely earned a place on the map. Honey B has a unique style that is reflected in the cups they use and the unique flavors they have. 

I got the Taiwan Iced Milk Drink with boba pearls. I was very impressed with the flavor and the boba was spot on. They put the time in to properly boil the boba and put it in a sugar solution. It's a little pricy, as the cost out to greater $5 for some of the specialty drinks, but the cup size is legit (despite that it looks smaller).  

I would love to come back and try some of the other flavors!
author: Vasiliy M.

description: If your coming here to get boba and tea it's is amazing and the popcorn chicken + French fries are sensational. The only problem I have is the customer service I ordered a certain drink and got the wrong one so they kindly gave me a new one but they didn't put one of my orders down and started to get kind of snappy. But all in all great tea great food and wonderful tea place!
author: Fyrce 3.

description: They try to do better, small family business. Price is reasonable and has yelp discount.  Space is clean and food is fresh. Good place to hang out a bit.
author: Food Is L.

description: Really big size of drinks. And my favorite is Brown Sugar Milk Drink since it has no caffeine!
author: Jaylene L.

description:
I was turned onto this place by fellow yelper Sarin P. even though it's painfully close to my home. I'm lazy; so sue me!

I've had a few chances to try it out and I have to say that it's my new favorite in a half mile vicinity. I usually get iced milk drink type stuff, sometimes tea based. The tapioca balls are tasty enough. 

The popcorn chicken is merely okay. Just a tad bit too salty for me. I usually stray away from boba house food items anyway. I'm a slurpee man. Can't stand stand the hot dogs!

So come here for some refreshments and go eat somewhere else, I suppose!
author: Aren A.

description: Nothing special. Think of it like a quickly. I think they mostly use syrup for every flavor.
author: Victor D.

description:
I would give this place 5 stars for their hot toffee green milk tea with half sugar, and at 50% off for a fb check in, price and taste just can't be beat. The hot toffee green milk tea is so incredibly notably memorably delicious. Seriously one of the best milk teas I've ever had. Gotta try it. 

Their popcorn chicken, while it has a good flavor, actually has very little chicken. It's just all fried breading. Terrible. And that's the reason this place didn't get 5 stars from me. Oh, and also their food prices are quite high. Almost $4 for the egg puff?! Huge rip off. 

Service is friendly. They take credit cards, including Amex, so that's another plus.
author: Jennifer W.

description: The sweet potato fries are a must-have here. They are seasoned with seaweed, sesame seeds, and sea salt -- so good!!! I managed to come here on two separate occasions in the same week -- if that's not telling then I don't know what is. Milk tea options are endless but I always stick to my favorite (Jasmine Milk tea).
author: Sarin P.

description: We were across the street for dinner and decided to get a drink afterwards.  Since this place was the closest to our car, I told my husband that we should get our drinks here.  It was about 9:30pm on a Saturday night and this place wasn't busy.  I ordered a ginger milk tea with boba and a Thai tea with boba.  The total was about $10.  As soon we left, we took a sip of our drinks.  We didn't like any of the drinks.  The ginger milk tea tasted like ginger milk.  I did not taste any tea flavor.  As for the Thai tea, it tasted artificial (like it was made from powder).  The bobas were flavorless.  I doubt we'll be back.
author: Sandy Q.

description: Try their honey boba made with real milk. Fried chicken appetizer is also a must. Relaxed environment with plenty of seats to sit.
author: Lily P.

description:
We popped in to Honey B after the open mic at Bazaar Cafe nearby.  We were having a night crammed with activities, with little time to expend on food, so a "snack" shop seemed like the best bet.  I was impressed with how clean the little place is.  My boyfriend didn't seem much into it as we looked at it from across the street, and I had half expected to want to walk out the second we got in.  The girl standing in front of the counter was friendly, almost bubbly and didn't mind that we just kind of stood there staring at the menu. 

They serve bubble teas and small snacks, for VERY good prices.  We ordered the black milk tea with boba and no sweetener (after reading another Yelper's review stating the quality of their sweeteners).  The girl at the counter actually asked me whether I wanted the tea sweetened or not, so there wasn't even a need for me to go out of my way to order it that way.  The tapioca is slightly sweet itself, so if you like the taste of tea, I recommend ordering it this way.

The snacks really are cheap - we got the egg puff and the fried squid.  Both were about 4 dollars.  The egg puff was slightly sweet and came out at the right heat to eat immediately.  The squid was crunchy and seasoned pretty perfectly.

I give it a 5 star because I was pleasantly, and unexpectedly, surprised by Honey B.  Good snacks, low prices, and a clean and friendly environment.  Looks good to me.
author: Sharon R.

description: I really, really, enjoyed my brown sugar Taiwan drink with red bean & grass jelly. So good! A bit pricey, $5.40, but it's a huge cup.
author: Freckles H.

description:
I've walked by this shop so many times and finally decided to try it out! It was pretty busy when we arrived, and only 1 girl was working so we did have to wait a bit for her to finish a few orders. But it gave us time to peruse the HUGE menu! I ended up choosing the Strawberry Basil Green Tea and it was amazing! There is something magical about the combination of Strawberry and Basil, and this tea was just perfect for a hot day.

Only after I ordered did I notice they also have Watermelon Slushes! I cannot wait to come back here and try more drinks!
author: Larissa S.

description: We stopped for a snack. They have a great selection of teas. I had the peach:green tea with no added sugar. The peach was very sweet so it didn't need sugar. We also tried the calamari, very tender and light crust. The red bean egg puff was delicious. It tasted like a sweet waffle with a creamy red bean inside each square.
author: Pamela D.

description: I ordered a milk tea and asked for less sugar. Well, it came out not sweet at all indeed, but at the same time it tasted like water. Wait, did they just add more water to dilute it? I think so. :( Probably won't return again.
author: Steve C.

description: We stopped by on a Wednesday afternoon and got the classic iced tea. The boba was not the best admittedly. It lacked any chewiness and completely fell apart in your mouth. Perhaps the quality is better in in busy hours? Definitely not worth dropping the $4 here.
author: Clarence C.

description: I ordered the onion rings and mozzarella sticks and they were BOMB!!! I also ordered the matcha green milk tea with boba and it was pretty good also, just too sweet for me!
author: Dom B.

description: My favourite boba place in all of town, has a strong tea taste and not just watered down milk. Their boba is really trash too although I would love to get a smaller size cup. (But I always end up finishing it anyway haha) great place if you just wanna hang with your friends or get a laptop out and start working.
author: Cheryl C.

description: Decent taste. It's an A-OK spot. However, i am tired of them always messing up my order and this is like the 4th time. I've asked for Lychee Jelly and they gave me Grass Jelly. The first time, okay maybe i'll let it slide but as the mistakes keep repeating, it is not okay. Other times is when i ask for Milk Teas but they happened to serve my drink as Tea drinks. Hopefully next time will change my perspective on this place.
author: Stacey M.

description:
My boyfriend lovesssss this place. He said the boba are always a hit here whereas at other places you might get overcooked, way too soft, and not chewy tapioca. But at honey bee it's always cooked to perfection with the right amount of chewiness. I usually don't get tapioca in my drinks but I'd take a sip of his and they're always chewy - not too hard not too soft and not too sweet, it's perfect. 

I've tried their jasmine milk tea, taro milk, and black milk tea. Which are all good. I usually get grass jelly with my drinks and their grass jelly is good too. But it's nothing amazing hence the 3 stars. I'd definitely come back again but it's not a place I see myself having cravings over.
author: Michelle T.

description: Some of their drinks are really similar to purple kow, as well as the size of their cups too. They have very unique names for some drinks, but I was too scared to try. The decor of the store is very cute and spacious! I tried their ice milk drink with honey boba and there is definitely a strong taste difference between honey boba and just regular boba. Rating the drink out of 5, it would just be a 3. I will come back again to try other drinks and their food.
author: Vanessa L.

description:
10% off with yelp check in!
large variety of drinks and cups are large like purple kow. definitely get a punch card! Friendly and fast service. $10 dollar minimum for credit card purchases.
author: Jimmy C.

description:
I got that love for my honeybee, Honey B.

Pros: 
- Never crowded like Purple Kow.
- Spacious interior.
- Open late.
- Extensive menu that's not too overwhelming.
- Accepts cash & card ($10 minimum)
- They have unique drinks here (cheese tea cream, tomato drink that I forget what it's called)
- They now have snacks!

With pros, there are always cons:
- Pricey drinks.
- Fruit teas made with syrup and not fruits.
- Parking is a biatch.
- Workers are a bit laggy even though the place is practically empty most of the time.

My to-go-to drinks here are the mint milk tea and the matcha tea cream. I'd stick to their milk teas here instead of any other drinks, especially the fruity ones. Otherwise, I choose the Honey B over the Purple Kow any day!
author: Jerianne G.

description:
Ordered 4 drinks about an hour ago. 
Waited about 15 minutes.
1. Green Apple Slush 2/5 not sweet nor sour at all
2. Imperial Milk Tea 2/5 way too sweet
3. Iced Milk Drink with Boba and Pudding 2/5(the cashier didn't tell me that they ran out of big boba;instead, she assumed that I am okay with small boba) errrr No!!!
4.Mango Green Tea with Aloe 3/5 nothing special; taste just like chopped mango with mango syrup mixed in green tea 

Unhappy Customer
author: Elaine Y.

description:
Came here after dinner at around 10pm on a Friday night and the place was empty except for a table in the back. I was intrigued by their sea salt cheese tea cream since I remembered regretting not ever ordering this mango cheese shaved ice in Korea and so I wanted to know what was the fascination with cheese in desserts. It was also their top 10 item so couldn't be that too weird of a choice.

I did enjoy it. To me it tasted just like a green tea crema drink. There was probably a slight cheesy taste in the crema but it wasn't overpowering since the sea salt really balanced it out. Overall, it was mostly just a green tea crema with sea salt. Still, I like it. I can't vouch for their other drinks but they did come in those big round jumbo cups. My crema came in a regular sized tall cup and they only have one size for the drinks so no debating over small or large.

Spacious place so good for groups wanting to come and sit at a table with friends. They also have snacks I think because we ordered fries.
author: Diana C.

description:
The semi-cute aesthetic drew me in.. Such a shame. 
The place was empty on a Sunday afternoon with one employee texting behind the counter. The drink menu sounds really yummy, so maybe I just ordered something gross?
I ordered a mango slush with boba and my friend got a strawberry slush. Came out to over $10 somehow.. And she didn't ask any preferences in sizes or toppings or anything else pretty much.
Literally 10 minutes later she comes from the back with 2 GIANT slushies that are hilighter pink and orange. The boba was alright, a little too small for my likings 
But the drink was so humongous and solely artificial syrup! Just ice. And syrup. We both felt so sick within 5 minutes of drinking it we threw them away
author: Emma G.

description: always order the black and green teas. slushies are great too. Ive had the fries and the wings-- not too bad. The sea salt is really really tasty! Egg puffs also are yum.
author: RayRay M.

description:
Like Purple Kow but worse. 

Milk teas are not quite as good. Taro and barley milk tea was chunky. Not expecting that texture. Bleh. 

Custard was not silky, tea crema topping was salty. 

The milk tea is better than quickly but overall everything else is subpar.
author: Jess C.

description:
They keep the fryers on now so I get my food in a reasonable amount of time. Portions smaller than other places. This is my go-to spot when I'm working. 





I came in for lunch. There was no one there except me and the cashier. I ordered popcorn chicken and a caramel milk tea. In one minute I got my tea. Great. In 15 minutes I had to ask about my food and that's when the cashier finally told me the fryer wasn't working. She should have told me that ten minutes ago!!! I'm on my LUNCH BREAK. I don't have an hour to be told I'm not getting any food. 

They gave me a refund for the food I ordered, which is what they were supposed to do, but now I'm going back to work with no lunch. Don't come here if you're hungry.
author: Christine A.

description:
Got here while waiting to get my table at another restaurant in the area. 

Really liked their fresh peach green tea with aloe Vera. One of the best I tried in town  

Tea leaf egg not so good.
author: Nuno S.

description: Presidio people understand. They take forever to make drinks and sometimes they don't take your order even if they see you standing in line. Other than that the drinks are great.
author: Wendy L.

description:
Yet another new boba joint?!  I swear, my list of boba/drink places to try is about as long as my "been there, now it's time to review them" list.  And believe me, that is a LOOOOOOOOOONG, long list.

Although TPumps has tickled my interest more so than Honey B, my friend and I ended up come here instead since A) we were already in the area, and B) the line was short.  Considering how bad the wait can be at places like TPumps and Purple Kow, I cannot stress how important B) is these days.

Since it was my first time here, I kept it simple with one of my usual orders - Milk Tea with Boba and Lychee Jelly.  While it was a good sized drink for the money (comes in chubby cups), I didn't think it was that impressive.  The tea flavor was okay, but, like the consistency, it felt really thin and light...and not in a good way.  Sadly, the tapioca balls weren't much better either - just way too mushy and soft for my liking.  But hey...at least the lychee jelly was good?

While they've managed to squeeze in a handful of tables and chairs, the "sitting area" actually isn't all that large.  Unless you happen to luck into some seats, it's really more of a grab-and-go kind of spot (like most boba places...).  However, considering how hard parking around here can be at times, you're probably best off just dropping someone off and getting the drinks than circling around endlessly.

In any case, Honey B is really more of a TWO AND A HALF stars type of place for me, but rounding it down for now since it really didn't leave much of an impression.  I'll be back at some point to see how they do with a couple of my other favorites though, so this could very well change soon enough.  Still better than Tea Way for me, but I'd rather go to Purple Kow or Wonderful Foods (my favorite!).
author: Mike L.

description:
I think this place is about the same as Purple Kow. The cups are about the same size and have similar looks. Their menu is kind of similar too. I ended up ordering red bean milk tea with pudding. I know it sounds like an odd combo, but I was hooked on the one at Cafe Lattea in Cupertino so I was hoping that this one was just as good.

I was a little disappointed. The milk tea tasted a little watered down, but I think it might have been that the ice melted, diluting the drink. When I first picked up the drink, the cup felt a little warm, so that might have caused the ice to melt, making my drink taste watered down. They do have a good amount of red bean, which I liked. The pudding was very soft, so it was actually hard for me to taste the pudding. 

The drink was okay, overall. I wouldn't mind going back to try another drink. I heard that their boba is very good so I'll have to go back and try it.

The store is a little small so there is limited seating. But it has a good ambiance and the decor is nice. It would be a good hangout place to catch up with friends.
author: Andrea G.

description:
I came here with my sister because purple kows line was Insane. Skeptical because of the 3 star review but we gave it a shot anyways. 

Taiwan iced milk with honey Boba and grass jelly. 4/5: 
It had a good milk flavor it wasn't too sweet compared to purple kow. It came out fast and it had a good amount of Boba and grass jelly. Biggest drawback was the Boba. Some were soft and chewy while others were hard. I would come back for iced milk here.

Roasted oolong milk tea 5/5: had a strong oolong tea flavor, exactly how I like it. Was not too sweet. It tasted exactly like purple kows roasted oolong tea. I was quite impressed.

It was pretty packed in here as well but they handled the line pretty quickly and drinks came out within 5-10 mins of ordering. Since its near where I live, I will be back here more often!
Total for 2 drinks: $7
author: Stella J.

description:
What an unattractive honeybee!  

From the name, my thought that came to mind would be a bright yellow restaurant banner and yellow themed inside!  It ended up being a dirty, blackened banner and it looked like they are still trying to get the hang of starting up this place!

The layout was horrible!  They had very limited seating to enjoy the boba and the kitchen is too big!  They were not utilizing the whole infrastructure - please consider remodeling!

The servers were not buzzing like bees!  It took awhile for the drinks to come out and the ambiance was the opposite of bright, happy yellow!

Their boba didn't have the chewiness texture that most boba places do.  Their boba has probably been sitting idly for awhile due to the fact that there were not enough customers ordering up their boba!  

This Tea House definitely lacks energy, decor, depth and quality inside, outside and with their boba!

I left as an unhappy bumblebee.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
3 1/2

When I came back, they had pudding. Usually when you order a drink that has pudding, the standard is an egg pudding. 

I went home to discover that my iced milk, pudding and honey boba drink was chock full of MANGO PUDDING.

That is not okay. Somewhere, Taiwanese people are shaking their fists and wagging their fingers at you Honey B Tea House!

If you're not going to have the standard egg pudding and replace it with mango, YOU BETTER REDNECKGONIZE AND TELL SOMEBODY
author: Susy C.

description:
Sweetened Chemicals.

I got the Matcha Milk Tea, and I've now completely lost my appetite. Their drinks are like Purple Kow, but worse, if there ever were such a thing. The boba were small, completely lacked the springy-chewy texture boba should have, and tasted like they were sitting out in their pot for way too long. 

The milk tea itself was even worse. It had a terrible aftertaste like the drink was made of a terrible powder, milk, and a buttload of sugar. 

I'm not usually the type to give such low ratings, but I took two sips before throwing it away. Such a shame, that drink was just under $5.00 too.
author: Cara O.

description:
TPumps, I have cheated on you again. I am sorry. However, it was a fun experience! If NorCal's Purple Kow and SoCal's  Half and Half were to have a baby, it would be Honey B. 

Whatsup @ Honey B:
-WHAT? SAY IT LOUDER! I CANT HEAR YOU!!! It takes only 10 minutes and NOT 45 minutes for my drink? WHAO....
-wide variety of drinks: milk tea, slushes, egg puffs, coffee, fruit teas, tea, yogurt drinks, Taiwanese Styled milk teas, etc. 
-Accepts credit cards, however, MINIMUM $10
-No stamp cards yet....
-2 round tables and chairs against the windows, so a pretty small place
-quiet and good for studying, for now, before people start crowding this place once they find out about it
-cups are fat like Purple Kow and Half and Half, but a bit smaller. 
-their drinks are not sugar loaded like Purple Kow and Half and Half! 

Jasmine Matcha Green Milk Tea (3 stars): With added Honey Boba, $3.78. Like I mentioned, the baby of Purple Kow and Half and Half would be Honey B. Similar tub size, but much cheaper and takes less time to receive it. It had strong tea tastes. I can see how some people would not like this because they're so used to powdered drinks like teaway. But its actually refreshing and had jasmine flavor and not just loads of sugar. Next time, I would ask for light ice because they put a little too much ice for me. The honey boba was sweet and soft to balance with the strong tea flavor!
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/honey-b-tea-house-san-francisco?select=aYMNL84BxfkuEScnHh8xrQ#TvFwGtPumWqTcOoyUI3EGA

Honey Boba, Pudding Taiwanese Style Milk Tea (3.5 stars): My friend ordered this and I had a sip. I enjoyed it thoroughly. It can be compared to Half and Half and Purple Kow's pudding boba caramel milk tea. It was definitely delicious and it was not twitchingly sweet. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/honey-b-tea-house-san-francisco?select=aYMNL84BxfkuEScnHh8xrQ#aYMNL84BxfkuEScnHh8xrQ

A week ago I had intended to go here and try it but didnt have a chance, thanks to my Yelp friend, Felipe L., I was able to try it out today! Overall a good experience! However, they should work on their decor. Nothing special, but it's good in that its a bit cheaper, no 40 min wait, and its not overly sweet.
author: Chena N.

description:
This spot is just as good as purple kow and I'm so glad they opened up and took over the old quickly's!! It's like half and half in socal! 

The honey boba... mMm... I've always preferred that over regular boba. 

Wait time... is about 5-10 minutes. Oh and there's never a line!

Seating... there's definetely not a lot of that. This spot is more of a grab and go.

Menu... it's extensive and there's so much to choose from! Oh but as for food, they only have egg puffs to go with the big container of boba.

From now on, this will be my choice over purple kow. All they need to do is give out the stamp cards and we'll be golden!
author: Ann T.

description:
This is actually a pretty good place for boba and egg puff.  I'm afraid to try new items on the menu so I usually just ordered milk tea with boba and egg puff.  They're actually really good compared to some other places.  I'm sure the other items are pretty good too.  Good hang out place and very relaxed environment.  Their egg puff is definitely better than Bamboo's egg puff.

They do take credit cards!! Min is $10 but if it's less than $10, they will charge you $0.50, which I don't mind as long as they take credit card.  A lot of small business like this usually only take cash, which I find very inconvenient.
author: Camille K.

description:
I like honey b, I like it more than purple kow... it had just opened a few weeks before I had moved to SF and apparently was "the new place" and we couldn't resist. The bf and I went there one weekday and decided their peach green tea was one of the better ones in the SF area. Their other items like milk tea was just kinda so-so. The prices are reasonable, can't use credit card for under 10 dollars (I believe). Also this is in inner Richmond which means I don't have to drive a gadzillion miles out to outer richmond for the other boba places.

I'd give it a 4.25 because I usually don't have to wait when I come. But on time, when I came, they had certain items that they were advertising on the board that they haven't rolled out with which I thought was weird... Either way, bring some cash and ordered their fruity (peach) green tea with aloe vera - you won't be disappointed!
author: Vanessa K.

description:
"HOW SWEET?" 
Just exactly how DO you answer this question? Seems like all the boba cafes have their own spectrum of sweetness levels.  At Honey B, I usually go with "just a little sweet, please" since their drinks are already on the sweet side.

Been here many times since it's only one block from my house. Today I tried the Mango Milk Green Tea. It's alriiiighttt. Nothing special. What really is yummy here are the Taiwan Style Iced Milk Drinks. Those are the BOMB. #76 is always on hit. Comes with caramel, pudding, and honey boba. Now do you understand why I don't need to add any more sweet to it??

The cafe is open until 11:00pm at night and they have free WiFi  (password posted next to cashier). But thus is not really the "I'm gonna camp out and crank out a paper cafe." Usually their are folks out with their friends to socialize. 

I recommend giving them a try and then comparing your boba drink to the 10 others in the area! Becoming a boba drink snob? No such thing.
author: Elisha Y.

description:
Had the milk tea with cheese cream because they were out of cream.  It didn't taste too cheesy to me which was good.
The milk tea was creamy and nice.
I'll be back to try the Jasmine milk tea!
author: Heejin L.

description:
Taro smoothie was good, but boba was a little over cooked, mushy.

I was the only order they had to make, two drinks took way too long to make
author: Karen T.

description: This place has an expansive and delicious selection of drinks, without being too expensive. I love the mint milk tea with boba, or chocolate pudding if I'm feeling fancy. Along with the cozy interior, there is free wi-fi! The service is not the fastest but the staff is friendly and helpful.
author: Elaine T.

description:
It's weird how they call out their order without tickets and in their heavy accents. It's hard to understand at times who's order is who and in what order. 

Other than that I like the tables. It's quiet enough to hear my friends when they speak. Popcorn chicken is ok. Their milk teas are a little too rich in my taste but actually you can tastes the strong flavor of the tea and and richness of the milk. I liked their flavor tea, next time I need to request for not as sweet. 

Asked for suggestions and the cashier person failed pretty hard at it. 

Popcorn chicken was more mystery meat than chicken. Good seasoning though.
author: Leme K.

description: Still my favorite boba place in the city. Get their taiwan brown sugar iced milk drinks, its on the menu between B1-B11. My favorite is B11 with red bean and grass jelly and B2 with pudding and honey boba.
author: Rily S.

description:
*meow* I said as I eyed this place. I had passed by numerous times, but for whatever reason never had the craving for a drink at the time. Today would be different though, as the pictures that beckoned from the Windows showing sweet and delectable drinks got the best of me, and I found myself stepping paw into Honey B.

Honey B is a bit more of a trendy looking spot than its nearby sharetea and Bambu competitors, and the menu proves to have some unique options for drinks and snacks. I decided to go for the Thai tea with tapioca. 

Service took a bit, and the person behind the counter seemed kind of robotic and impersonal, but then again, a lot of these sort of places are like that. 

Drink arrived, and was surprised to see that for the price, you get a lot more drink here than other places! That's a plus! The drink itself was nicely flavored but the tapioca was definitely a bit on the bland side. 


Overall, not too bad and a nice stop for me as I go back and forth through the area daily. 

With a try! 

*chirp*
author: Jei C.

description:
Cute place with about 5 tables and chairs that don't really quite match each other. You walk in and there's the giant menu on the left side and directly in front of you will be the cashier waiting for your order. Order what you want, pay the price, and take your receipt as you wait for your order. 

I got the matcha milk tea and had to pay an additional 50 cents for boba. I only subtracted a star cos I feel that milk tea should already include the cost of boba, but you know, to each their own. Cashier was quick with service and she smiled at me so good for her. 

I only had to wait about 2-3 minutes for my order and the drink itself was not bad although I am getting tired of those big fat cups. Half way through drinking it, I'm already feeling queasy from the large intake of milk tea, but again- it was yum. I managed to finish it all later in the day after many needed breaks.
author: Venus L.

description:
3.5 stars.

I ordered just a basic milk tea with boba and it was pretty good. It was nothing like what I had in Taiwan but still decent.

I was the only patron in the store so the drink came out fairly quickly. The cashier that took my order was also very kind, something you never see in boba shops.

So far so good, someone recommend a good drink besides the typical milk tea please. :)
author: Mabel Y.

description: I was pleasantly surprised. It was recommended by a friend. Although the cost of the tea is a bit pricier than Purple Kow there is a bigger selection. My children enjoyed their selections of iced milk with brown sugar and flavored slushes/snow. It is not as sweet as Purple Kow's, which is a plus.
author: L L.

description:
Love this place and all the options they have! Hard to find a milk tea place with sweet delicious drinks without tea flavor in them. I recommend trying the Iced Milk Honey Boba, it tastes like butterscotch! 

They also have the best Boba tea decor of any shop I've seen! So adorable.
author: Adamme K.

description: I love walking down Clement looking at all these places. I decided to try Honey B because they have egg puff waffles, which I love. The waffle turned out to be disappointing. It's not as light as I like. Pretty thick and not sweet at all. I also had the Taiwanese style iced milk honey boba drink. It wasn't too sweet but didn't have much flavor either. It tasted like milk mixed with boba water. My boyfriend got the kumquat green tea, and he seemed to enjoy that. He said it is tart but not too sour.
author: Christine L.

description:
Been here a few times and I thought this place was pretty decent. I've had the mango tea with mango jelly, a Thai tea, and a red bean milk tea. They were all pretty good. I felt the Thai tea had a very strong tea taste. I've always had my drinks to go so it's hard to say how great the service is and I haven't tried their food/snacks. It does seem that they are always coming up with new flavors though. There were posters of their new flavors on the walls. 

Also, this place is cash only! Can't remember if there is an ATM inside, but I think there is.
author: Cathie N.

description:
They have improved a lot better than before! And they have more new drinks in the menu. Good job honey b!

5 stars - Toffee Milk Tea
Try it! And you won't get disappointed

5 stars - Strawberry Basil Green Tea
 This one tastes very fresh, and I like the the basil favor, and they just make it perfectly into the drink!

5 stars - Honeydew tea cream
It is the first time I try the creamer of fruit favor, and only they have it, I will come back for it next time !

5 stars - for their improved!
In the past , I don't like their egg puff because it looks like very ugly, but this time when my friend order it, it is very different ! It is better than before and looks delicious! 

Next time I will come back for the other snacks and drinks. Also, don't forget to tell them the sweet level. I usually get 75% of sweet.
author: Joann J.

description:
Neato! 
This place is so nice, and I really just bumped into it after dropping off my girlfriend at her place. 
The girl at the front did the most perfect job explaining all the different types of tea offering they have. She really wanted to make me feel comfortable with what I ordered, LOL I'm a little bad about trying other tea drinks besides the safe white people flavors.  
Anyways...I ended up getting the Fresh Mango Tea with the lightest sugar. It was a mango tea with little cut up pieces of mango Mmmm :) and they offer the tiny size boba instead I the typical small marble size. 
Honey B has so much to choose from, it's crazy... Smoothies, ice drinks, milk teas, coffees, fried snacks (delicious, I'm sure) boba, puddings, jelly things and their specialty is this cream top with different flavors. 
I got to taste my first jelly tonight... Coffee. Interesting -  tasted like Jell-O infuse coffee.
...maybe next time ;)
author: Tere C.

description:
WARNING: They don't "completely" accept credit card. There's a $10 minimum. So unless you're paying for your friend and their cousin, you probably won't meet the minimum.

My group of 10 got there at 10pm, beating the after-dinner dessert rush. We were that one annoying group that took up 3 tables and put them together and ordered 10 drinks plus snacks. Sorry, but it may happen again as we enjoyed their drinks so much.

However, even so, I don't think it should've taken that long. They took all 26 orders from everyone that came in at once, AND THEN started making our drinks even though there were 2 people working. While one was ringing people up, the other was nowhere in sight. I honestly thought there was only one guy working. Customer service is mehh...

I was reeaaaally disappointed that they were out of the Fresh Fruit & Flower Tea. But the Passion Green Tea wasn't bad - very passion-fruity. My friends' fresh fruit slushy things were super good and they could actually taste the real fruit, like many other reviews have stated. My sister was the only one with a complaint - she wasn't used to the stronger tea flavor in her Thai Iced Tea; but she's probably just spoiled by all the MUCH sweeter Thai Iced Teas in the area, which makes me think this one is legit.
author: Athena C.

description: Came here on Christmas Day because it was the only thing open in this area. We ordered some flavored milk tea drinks, got our drinks, and drove about 10 minutes to our next destination. By the time we got to our second stop, we noticed the milk tea had already separated. You know when it looks all powdery and the milk separates from all the syrup? Yeah, that's what it looked like AFTER 10 MINUTES. We tried shaking the cup and inverting it upside down, but it still looked gross and powdery. Here comes the taste test. It was by far the most disgusting milk tea I have ever had. And I've had a lot. I've also been to this specific location many times in the past (around when it first opened). I had ONE SIP, and I couldn't even continue drinking it anymore. It tasted like cardboard water, and I'm not even exaggerating. One sip, and I threw mine out. My brothers were a bit braver than I was, so they drank 2-3 sips before calling it quits. Cardboard water at about $5+ on avg for each drink was ridiculous. I've had bad milk tea before that I couldn't finish, but this one, I couldn't even take a second sip. I wish I could try this place again, but after this experience, I doubt that I'll ever return.
author: Michelle T.

description:
Milk tea crema hits the spot and reminds me of the SoCal tea cremas. Or tea creme. However you call them. I usually get it without the boba though. 
I don't remember how PK's taste but HB does it awesomely. 

I would suggest to less sweet/half sweet though - the amount of ice isn't too much of a problem but the sweetness can be overbearing for me sometimes.
author: Susan Y.

description: This place is me and my bf's little secret ^^ we stumbled upon this place a while a go whilst looking for something to kill our thirst and we were pleasantly surprised! This is by far the best boba place in SF, they have soooo many different flavors! Although we only drink one drink here (cause it's just that good): #87 Taiwan Brown Sugar Iced Milk drink with Taro Honey Boba. It's absolutely delicious. Note: we live in the Sunset area and always take Uber just to get here and enjoy their drinks :) only reason I am not giving it 5 is because their service is a bit on the slower side..
author: Kira U.

description:
This was my second time ever having iced milk (first time was at half and half in LA) and I think it was equally if not even MORE delicious here! Every sip was an explosion of honey, sweet chewy boba, and egg pudding (they are very generous with everything!), and they didn't go overboard with the ice so the drink was milky until the very end. The sweetness took me off guard at first, but luckily I was in the mood for SWEET so it was pretty wonderful. I wasn't asked what sweetness level I preferred but I heard the girl asking other customers...so yes apparently you can ask for less/more (I recommend less sweet, unless you have a powerful sweet tooth). The texture/chewiness and sweetness of the boba was perfect, and they even have small boba as well. 

The menu isn't ridiculously long and they don't sell snacks here except for egg puffs, but all the drinks sounds really appealing (matcha and taro drinks!). I also asked the girl if they use real taro, and she said yes (!!) you have no idea how exciting that is...I rarely come across boba shops that use real taro.


I also tried the egg puffs because I didn't have CASH and there is $10 minimum if you want to use a card (strictly enforced)...and they were aiite (freshly made though), but then again I'm not a fan of egg puffs. True story...I bought 2 orders of egg puffs that I didn't plan on eating just so I could meet the $10 minimum to use my card to get my iced milk drink.
author: Jessica C.

description:
Drinks are pretty cheap but the service could use some work.

I tried the peach milk black tea and it was pretty darn good, but their boba could be better.
My friend got the kumquat green tea and it tasted like how it's made in Taiwan

They have some seats available but they fill up quickly.
author: Cam C.

description:
It's great because it's open late, the boba drinks and slushies are good, but overall, the food and atmosphere are average.

If you're out late though, it's convenient because it's the only place open and is good for group hang outs.
author: Ashley E.

description: Interesting durian tea cream. Decent snacks.
author: Inigo M.

description: Good tea. The only complaint I have is that they have these cute little fat cups, but since I asked for a drink without ice, they gave it to me in a plain skinny cup. When I asked why, I was told that if they put it in the fat cup without ice, it would be a quarter empty. I have no way of telling if the amount is the same between the two cups. Credit card for only $10+.
author: Annie L.

description:
So insane that my friend would ask me to find her Taiwanese Tea Cream.
More insane that in that same weekend, I would find it while hunting for a random boba place near my dimsum place.

Honey B is good but their drinks are really heavy. Between their teas and their smoothies, it's difficult (for me at least) to drink a lot. Probably not a great place to go after being stuffed from lunch, but worth the try!

Read the sign about how to drink Tea Cream... It's informative and will make your experience much better!
author: Winè C.

description:
Expensive unflavorful boba and soggy/limp egg puffs= unhappy boba-lover who has vowed to never return. My honey green tea without boba cost $3.78 but I couldn't taste the tea or the honey. It was more like a fat cup of sweetened water with lots of ice and BAM there goes almost 4 bucks. 

The most disappointing part of the visit was when I asked them if the egg puffs were meant to be soggy since I've never had it that texture. It was cold and limp like it has been sitting out in the display case for over 2 wks. I asked NICELY if they could reheat it or do something with it since it didn't taste right and the guy just said "oh it's served like that." .....um ok. 

if you come here, i hope you have better luck but if you're not desperate and willing to drive just a little further, go elsewhere because this place definitely needs a lesson on customer service and making the stuff offered on their own menu. 

another big negative= credit card minimum of $10.
author: Patricia K.

description:
Decent boba, probably the best in the city actually! But of course that ain't saying much. For a city with such a high Asian population, there's a serious lack of good boba and I gotta go out to oakland for some Chatime.

However, this is very good, and I really like the taro milk tea. There's actual chunks of taro in the drink, giving it a nice tactile feel in your mouth.

Docking another point for the stupid giant fat cups that don't fit in your cup holder, but at least they give you a normal one if you ask.
author: Tu T.

description: I definitely agree that this could be comparable to Purple Kow. It has the same real tea flavor and it doesn't have a wait. They are super fast at making drinks too! I was expecting to wait a long time like we usually do at Purple Kow. Their boba is pretty good too.. good texture and the right sweetness.
author: Tiff C.

description:
TAIWANESE MILK TEA WITH HONEY BOBA

^^^^ Must get!

It's so delicious.  The first time I went to Honey B, I wasn't sure what to order and the girl at the cash register recommended me the drink.  At first I thought she was trying to make me spend more money because it was like ~$4.75 but I gave it a shot anyway.  Turns out, its SO YUMMY!  If you LOVE sweets, you'll love that drink!  Trust.  The drinks are also in a cute cup and I would say that this place has great boba!  Usually boba is too hard/ too chewy but the texture is just right and plentiful where I have a good ratio of boba to milk tea :)

I always go back and get the Taiwanese drinks.  I haven't personally tried any of their regular milk teas...  One day I will.  They also have this cheese milk tea??  That's on my bucket list to try but I'm content with the taiwanese milk teas :)

Oh yeah, it's also pretty neat that they have a poster that describes what boba is.  Because I feel like a lot of people don't know what it is and think its weird when its really the best invention ever!  

Why I give it 4 stars is because of the $10 minimum charge if you use card :( The first time I was there I had to drive off to Geneva to go to an bank to withdrawal cash... So inconvenient.
author: Nicole C.

description:
I've been to this place a couple of time's now, and despite some negative hear-say about the place its actually pretty good! 
I ended up here for the first time on a friday night when the line at Purple Kow was out the door and around the block. 
I ordered the Iced milk drink with caramel, pudding and boba and it was GOOD. 
It's really sweet and you feel like your gonna get diabetes if you drink to much but that what an Iced Milk Drink is supposed to feel like! 
I haven't had any of their other stuff because I get the same thing every time I go but i would assume their other stuff is good too. 
This place is good alternative to PK (no line!) and there's also un-crowded seating area.
author: Antonio W.

description:
A new boba place landed in SF and I was skeptical about trying it because of the low reviews.  But babe's friend thought one of the drinks tasted like Half & Half so we decided to give it a go. I've never had Half & Half so I suppose this will be my closest experience. 

I got the Taiwan style iced milk drink with pudding and honey boba. First sip, I immediately thought of Purple Kow's milk drink but less sweet in a much better way. Wow, good bye to Purple Kow, not waiting there for more than an hour again for your tapioca when I can just come here. 

Babe got the Oolong Milk Tea with honey boba - it wasn't bad at all, it was more on the tea taste and he liked it a lot. 

Boba was really chewy and sweet.  

I think people don't like this place is because when people think about milk tea, they think about artifical flavors and powders that make their drinks sweet and had to pause when it actually tasted like tea.
author: Harriet W.

description:
I decided to try a new boba place last night with one of my friends among other various boba joints we could have went to, so I chose here! Parking was super easy as we were able to find parking across the street and it wasn't packed at all even though it was around 10PM. My friend and I were able to get our orders placed right away. It took us a while to decide what to get because of the various selection of drinks they offer (I feel as if it is more than purple kow! They offer all types of black tea, green tea (both with the option of milk as well), oolong, the fresh milk drink, flavored teas, etc.) He got a red bean milk tea with pearls and I got a strawberry green milk tea with pudding. Both drinks came in those chubby cups! Another reason why this place is cool. But overall, I found the drinks to be average for the most part. My strawberry green milk tea was more sweet for my liking, and my friend's drink had bits of red bean which is pretty typical. 

What I liked most about this place is the ambiance, since it's really clean and a plentiful of seating. Reminds me of being in a coffee shop or some sort of japanese restaurant! Not to mention I glanced over their counter and saw they have a health inspection score of 100. Definitely a plus right there. I wouldn't go out of my way again to come here, but if I was in the area then yeah, I would come back again.
author: Kathleen S.

description:
Quickly has been replaced by another boba drink shop, Honey B. Honey B doesn't have hundreds of drinks but it has plenty to choose from, including milk tea, yogurt drinks, tea lattes, fresh tea, fruit blend tea, fruit slush, coffee, etc. Drinks are available hot or cold. Drink add ins like boba, jellies and red beans are 50 cents each. They only have one type of snack right now, egg puffs. I hope they add more snacks, especially popcorn chicken.

* Matcha green milk tea with honey boba ($3.78): It's a huge cup, the size and shape of Half & Half's (25 ozs.) and there's only one cup size available. The milk tea had a nice creaminess and real tea flavor. The pearls/boba were very sweet and chewy. They were a bit goopy. The drink was a little too sweet for me. What really bothered me is that 1/2 of the cup was filled with ice.That's way more ice than usual!

The décor was simple with pictures of drinks on the wall, counter seating and a few small tables. 

$10 credit card minimum.
author: Lolia S.

description:
I'll be blunt.

If you love Hello Kitty, you are going to love Honey B Tea House. 

But don't tell that to the various thuggy looking A$N young punkasses the other night who look like they were denied insignificant roles in the Hong Kong movie 2013 remake of Young and Dangerous Reloaded (where the movie poster of the main characters look more like a bunch of giggolos looking for some action, rather than picking up a piece of cutlery or drain pipe to cut up a competitor), and trying to exude some sort of masculinity by slurping balls through a straw in a cup containing some murky mixture to pass the time. Ahhh San Francisco night life for A$Ns is grand.

Srsly, how can someone who is smitten by cuteness to the extreme, say no to a pair of little babies equipped with bumblebee wings and antennae, whose cartoony mugs are plastered over the store's logo?

The "goo dzau wei hung tsa" (old school flavor black tea) seemed like an interesting choice to me, and so I ordered one and requested honey only as the sweetener. Bottom line, it was ok, but not my cuppa. It tasted very earthy, like a cross between roasted barley and roasted oolong, which is not quite the right kind to use for plain black tea (particularly old school flavor). For those who don't know their boba history, a while ways back in Taiwan, some entrepreneur around Taichung figured out a way to brew black tea properly as well as create a classic iced version, and sold it off a cart. Some sugar/sweetener, ice, and black tea. That was how iced tea started in TW. Years later this would be dubbed old school flavor, as part of marketing/labeling.

Then someone stole the idea and innovated on it further, and thus added the right kind of milk, and added fun yuan which was then tapioca (and fresh I might add, not the rehydrated kind), and thus tapioca milk tea was born. This was in the early 1980s...so it took almost 30 years for this export to explode worldwide and become...diluted. Apparently some HK film starlet in the 80s was known for her uhm...chesty assets, and some TW entrepreneur made bigger tapiocas, and called them boba (bor ba = spheres galore), in "honor" of the chesty queen's assets....who interestingly went on to become Jet Li's wife. Yes THAT Jet Li. Even the kung fu man likes his giant spheres! So for those making jokes about ball sucking through a straw, are in theory misplaced about the reference to the anatomy :-o.

But going back.... this style of tea is not for me, not even if it were made into tapioca milk tea. It will likely work good for those who prefer the sweet thick, yet flavorful tapioca milk teas....and Hello Kitty.
author: Ken K.

description:
The boba drinks are ok here. What I usually order here is a little more expensive than Purple Kow, but I like the fact that I can choose the width of my cup. These cups can fit in cup holders! 

The boba itself is chewy, but it's a little too chewy for me.
author: Rachel H.

description:
I was on a last minute mission to find a
Tapioca drink before heading to the airport and stumbled across Honey B. I must say I was pretty pleased with my green milk tea tapioca.
author: Oanh N.

description: My favorite milk tea place. They have a lot of drink options which I like. My favorite drink has to be strawberry basil tea, delicious! They have popcorn chicken and other snacks. Oh, portion is smaller than other places though.
author: Queenie L.

description:
Honey B is another Taiwan styled tea purveyor. most of the menu is tea based/themed.

menu: teas, milk teas, fresh fruit slushes, yogurt drink,  hot grass jelly, coffees, fruit flavored teas, waffle eggs..

music: soft rock.

pour: jasmine tea (2.98)
-small tub like container, 25 ounces, not much ice
-real tea flavor, could taste bitterness of tea.
4 stars only for the tea drinks.
-came within minutes

drips:
-reviews mention some drinks use syrups not real fruit. (ugh!)
would avoid fruit drinks, just stick with the real tea.
-some drinks may seem pricey (4)
-real tea @3 ok for me.
-just a few tables for sitdown.
-looks better than the old quickly
author: Victor G.

description: Please change your friday hours. I went there at 10:10pm and you guys were already closed. I drove all the way from Sunset to Richmond just to get it as well.
author: Winson Z.

description:
The first time I tried Honey B I disliked it. I ordered the Honey Milk Black Tea and it was overly sweet. The second time I had Honey B, I strongly disliked it. I tried their regular Milk Black Tea and it was super watery. I figured, third times the charm... why not, I ordered the Mango Slushie and it tasted like Mango flavored water. I was really disappointed. 

Until one day, after running errands with my boyfriend we wanted to grab boba. Since he lives a few blocks away from this joint, we did not want to walk all the way to 17th Ave for ShareTea. I was feeling adventurous and decided to pick something random from their menu. I went with their Mint Black Milk Tea and it forever changed my opinion about this place. Theres just something about their peppermint. It is not overly toothpaste minty nor did it taste like minty gum. The peppermint infused with their black tea gives it a distinct taste and it is very deeeericious :P

Their Mint Black Milk Tea is my to go to drink :) 
Maybe you should give it a try!
author: Emily L.

description:
Honey B Tea House, Outer Richmond's new Bubble Tea House which was formerly a quickly location. My wife and I were excited once we heard that a new boba place had opened up. The place has 3 small round tables, cute decor, and a very nice worker who helped take our order. 

Drinks Ordered:

-- #19 Matcha Green Milk Tea with Tapioca [$2.98]

The green tea was light in flavor, balls were soft but a bit chewy (better than quickly's), and a little too much ice. Unfortunately the drink did not have us craving for more. However since this place is still new we'll probably come back and give them a try again after they have settled in.

Quick Tips:

-- Minimum for Credit Cards: $10

The Good: Cute cups (like Purple Kow), short line, straight forward menu

The Bad: Not Purple Kow
author: Matthew M.

description: What can I say? This place is great! Good drinks and snacks, they have corn nuggets!! Only give it 4 stars is because no restroom.
author: Kev C.

description:
Would be 5 stars but I've had better.  For the price,  wait,  and taste,  HB is deserving of a really solid 4 stars.  Thank you for having great tea creams (although I can't finish the cream--too rich/salty (?),  the tea is ahhhhmmmmmaaazzzing) -- tea is pretty strong.

Rest assured,  I'll be back. After all,  I now have a stamp card to fill!  ;)
author: Jennifer Y.

description: Extensive menu, try the more "uncommon" flavors and you will be pleasantly surprised.
author: Peter S.

description:
First time here my drink was okay, but the other people I went with weren't as lucky. My friend asked if they could do more tea and less milk on her drink. By them saying yes, we assumed they knew what that meant. Wrong. Her drink was way too sweet, and as if they did the opposite, add more milk and less tea. They were nice enough to fix it and get her a new drink. My other two friends ordered the exact same thing. Oddly they tasted different. 

Second time here, I came with two different people and we didn't have the best experience. Plus, when we left there were like 4 full milk tea cups abandoned on the sidewalk. Either those people were drunk and forgot their drinks, or they were not pleased. 

One more thing, the sticker on their cups made them hella ghetto.
author: Oriel F.

description: One of my favorite boba places in SF! I always go here with my sister and we just love it! The people there are always nice and helpful when asked for recommendations. I always get their taro milk tea or their longan milk tea. Their taro milk tea is very different from the usual taro at other boba places (it kind of has a little nutty flavor, or it just might be me). Their slushes are also bomb and smoothly blended without giant chunks of ice~ I highly recommend any of their milk teas and slushes. If you're adventurous check out their cheese tea cream, it's pretty interesting  but I personally like it!
author: Gloria C.

description:
This place has decent boba, but it's not amazing. Then again, I'm not sure I've ever had amazing milk tea outside of Asia.

 It's got a great location with some great restaurants nearby. I think I've gotten the regular milk tea and it was good, but not amazing. Also got a strawberry milk I think, and that was decent. Overall, I've had a decent time there, but nothing mind blowing.
author: Nina Y.

description:
On a good note, their boba drinks are literally amazeBALLS! Probably the best I've had in the city thus far.

I really, really, really wish this place would improve their service. I'm not one to be super negative, but they were clearly understaffed and unorganized. For example, when I arrived, there was only one person in front of me and I ordered 1 drink (simple, right?). Of course a line formed behind me, so they got super busy. 10 minutes went by, then 15, then 20... Then finally the guy in front of me got his drinks which gave me hope since I thought I'd get my drink right after. Nope! A couple of people behind me got their drinks before I did. Again, I'm usually patient and can understand that it was busy, but I decided to remind the cashier that I did not get my drink yet (he had to ask what I ordered and how many drinks). Then, he forgot to add the boba... =( But I wasn't going to wait that long for nothing, so I told him to add it...

But after getting some air outside, I was so happy/relieved that their JASMINE MILK TEA was soooo good, hence the 3 stars instead of a 2. Plus, it comes in what looks more of a bowl than a cup (in a good way). 

I'll be back, but just hope that service will be better!
author: Sammie T.

description:
Overall Impression: A variety of choices to suit the boba needs of everyone... if everyone has a high tolerance for sweetness. Luckily, I am one of these people.

Cost: Happy wallet every time. Affordable prices for boba and snacks.

Taste: Sweet honey boba, but that is expected. They put extra ingredients like strawberry jam in mine. It was an interesting, yet appealing new taste. Also tried the popcorn chicken and didn't care too much for it (bland). Go to Quickly's for your snack cravings instead.

Customer Service: Decent service. Order was fulfilled in a reasonable amount of time.

Ambience/Atmosphere: The store walls are filled with their menu from top to bottom. They seemed to have made it work.
author: Kevin T.

description: I ordered the Thai tea and asked for less ice and the girl making it adds EXTRA ice and fills the cup only 3/4 of the way full and the rest of the 1/4 with ice. Also, I don't recommend the Thai tea flavour because it tastes similar to Chinese herbal tea and has a bitter aftertaste.
author: June B.

description:
Came here on friday night after a heavy dinner at Hark Knox Cafe. This place was just down the block was decided to try this one instead of InfiniTea. When we arrived it was quite empty which is unusual for a boba cafe. Was greeted by very friendly cashier who was patient while we decided on our boba drinks.

My friends ordered Milk Tea and Oolong while I decided to stick with my staple the Green Milk Tea. However they did not service Green/Jasmine milk tea instead only served Matcha Green Milk Tea which is a Japanese type of powder Tea. The cashier assured me the taste was near identical to jasmine green tea milk tea found in other boba cafes. For me standard size drink+ boba = $3.78. A bit pricey especially since boba cafes in the sunset are easily a dollar less. 

How was the taste? Not what the cashier assured me of. The taste was nowhere close to Jasmine Green Milk Tea. It had a strange after taste that reminded of seafood 0_0. I have had Matcha Green Milk Tea before and there was always a distinct difference compared to other milk teas. However this drink still did not resemble the taste of that either I'm afraid. Was very disappointed with my drink I just couldn't finish the rest.

I'm not completely bagging on Honey B and their drinks. I sampled my friend's milk tea and Oolong and those were decent. Its just my experience with my drink was not that great. 

With the premium price of Honey B's milk tea for a substandard product and average size I'd rather bring my money to Tpumps where I can get a larger drink+customization and actual Green Milk Tea.
author: Jude N.

description:
Pricey compared to competitors and for what you're getting. Thought this was going to be my savior from the longgggggggg lines at purple kow. First time i tried it, i thought it was decent. Second and third time... realized it was just average. I would come back if i have a craving, just not as likely. 

FYI: Store is packed with school kids around 2-3pm on weekdays. I would assume that's their rush of the day. So that's probably not the best time to go.
author: Tina S.

description: We first went to Purple Kow, but the line was long, so we drove to this place on Clement. I got a lychee milk tea and liked it. Drink menu is extensive and interesting to choose from. Also, got sweet potato fries and those were good. I liked this place and would come back...but it's in the Richmond and I'm a Sunset person.
author: Denise C.

description:
Had to circle around the block a second time before finding this place because the banner was not lit very well. I was expecting a brightly lit banner, I'm not sure why. If any of you have a reasonable explanation, let me know. 

I had a number 18 milk tea with tapioca. My friend had something fruity drink and he thought HE was getting tapioca too because she was asking him about tapioca size for my order(?, btw- lady I can speak for myself you know) and yeah. It was confusing and I'm ok if you didn't understand what I just said. 

The first sip, I like that it didn't have a funky power/syrup taste to it. A few sips later I thought it was a bit watered down. Quarter cup later, too many tapioca balls for me to really be able to drink the liquids. Another few sips later, noticed that some tapioca balls had this mushy layer around it and it wasn't as firm (no pun here sickos). 

Overall, it's not a bad place for a tapioca drink. I only had one person in front of me before I ordered. 

However, they need to figure out how to fix their line and door arrangement because I elbowed someone's side on my way out as I was opening the door (sorry!).

Oh and one more thing, am I the only one out where who's sick of these fat and flatter cup sizes? It doesn't fit in my cup holder and it's too cold to hold it in my hand/between my legs while driving. Can we please have regular cups again? You will be super cool.
author: Jess W.

description:
This place has the worst Taro Milk Tea.  It doesn't look or does it look anything like Taro.  It simply looked and tasted like a regular Milk Tea.  I added Boba as well as egg pudding.  They give you little boba and their egg pudding has no taste.  

In addition, I wanted to get their egg tarts.  They didn't have any batter!  What a big disappointment.  

Why would anyone open a boba tea station when their drink isn't that great?  I would have expected more especially when you're located primary in an Asian community.

Nothing special about this place.
author: MB V.

description:
Just another Taiwanese boba shop in Richmond district.

Iced mango green tea: not enough tea taste. Mango taste prevails, while surprisingly, there seems to be fresh mango in the first place. They put the tea in a tub like Jazentea in south bay.

Nothing to write home about. The place is cheap and no frills; no one appears to socialize there, but it may be because I went during off hours. Menu is huge, as they offer every assortment of teas and some HK style snacks.
author: Jay C.

description:
The customer service was very disappointing. I ordered one slush, two pudding drinks, and two popcorn chicken. It took 20 minutes for me to finally get my food. The problem with Honey Bee was that they didn't know how to prioritize the orders or what to do when the orders were ready. 

Inside the kitchen, there is a "ready" station where completed food items are placed on a tray. When the entire order is complete, an employee would take the tray of food and take it to the counter and hand the food to the customer. The ready station is visible to the public. So, I could see that my slush drink was completed first, then the pudding drinks, and then the popcorn chicken. That took about 15 minutes. For the rest of the 5 minutes, the food was just sitting at the ready station. No one bothered to check whether or not the order had been completed already.
