The front counter person and the cook both were just working away in the back while I was trying to get their attention. I didn't see why they couldn't just spend 5 seconds to check the completed orders. Plus, it was not busy at all. There was just another customer in the shop waiting for his order. 

Because the slush drink was made first, it was just sitting at the station for at least 15 minutes, the slush almost turned into liquid. When I spoke to the employee, all she could do was apologize. How about making me a new one? 

In terms of the quality of the food, the drinks were too sweet. Both of my friends and I threw away the drinks without finishing them. All we could taste was sugar and not much of anything else. 

To the Honey Bee owner, taste your own creations and pay attention to customer service. Tell your employees to prioritize. There are so many boba/drink places in the neighborhood. Competition is high, and we could walk away anytime.
author: GR Z.

description:
I'm not sure why anyone ever raves about Purple Kow. I always find it too sweet and quality is whatever.

Honey B makes a good milk black tea. I don't really care for boba, but I like adding in pudding and grass jelly. It's GOOOOD! 

Anyways, I always get greedy and go with a chubby, but I guess I'm not much of a chubby because I can't ever finish it, haha. It's good so the way I see it, go big or go home!
author: Jeanette Y.

description:
Honey B's a new milk tea place that opened up in a district filled with MT places. They have a really nice looking logo with bees on it.

== Drinks ==

Their green milk tea is pretty mediocre. There wasn't a good tea flavor to the drinks. Tasted like milk and honey... Where's my tea...

Egg puffs were really terrible... avoid.

== Service ==

Service was slow especially for the egg puffs. The drinks came out quite a while before the egg puffs were ready. 

== Overall ==

There's better alternatives in this neighborhood.
author: Steven B.

description:
The service is good the guy behind the counter is very friendly.
Cheap, clean and good bobba. The only complain is that they don't have as many choices as Quickly.
But overall is a good enough place to get snack, bobba smoothies.
author: Ty N.

description:
Accessibility (Parking / Wait Time)

0/1 Star: street parking late at night is easy. No wait to order. Took over 30 minutes to get 7 orders popcorn chicken when there were no orders ahead of us.

_____

Service (Waiter / Cleanness / Ambiance)

0/1 Star: fast food style. 

_____

Taste (0=Not Edible / 1=Edible / 2=Good (average) / 3=Must Try!)

2/3 Stars: popcorn chicken taste the same here as all other tapioca shops. 

_____

Overall Experience

2/5 Stars 

_____

Last Words

Don't order more and 4 orders of popcorn chicken or it will take forever to cook.
author: Elliott N.

description:
I tried the kiwi slush it was nasty. We ordered the fries, tofu and lobster balls.
They were okay I want curry ball but they were out of stock. And it took them more than 10 minutes to make the food.  And no restroom inside.
author: R. K.

description:
Horrible service. Literally a  young angry Asian person as the cashier and I think if I hadn't noticed him yelling at me that my drink was done, then he would've thrown it at me. 

The taste is good, but I ordered red bean with my milk tea and what I got was smashed up red bean, and it didn't even have the amount that was advertised on their menu! By the way, you really don't want to mash up too much red bean in liquid drinks because the bean is starchy, which means that it is very uncomfortable to drink because you probably will choke on it frequently due to the small particles from the beans.

Also, don't come here if you only have card as payment. They'll charge you $10 for using your card. What in the world? Saw the sign and didn't believe it.
author: Elaine N.

description:
If you like Fantasia you will like this place! I kept it simple with my original black milk tea with boba and I loved it. It was more tea than milk based which I liked. The boba was chewy and fresh and because the cup size is so huge, they gave me a generous portion of boba. 

Also try the Thai Tea. Perfect combination of bitter and sweet. 

The only reason I took off a star is because of the service. None of them were very friendly. When I tried to compliment them on how delicious the milk tea was, they just looked away without saying a word. A little rude but I don't think they were trying to be. Overall, I would go back for the milk tea if I am in the area.
author: Kristen N.

description:
Yo, this place is terrible. There is nothing you can do to make your drink better. Not even half sweet will save you. 

The boba is so, so bad.
author: Margaret S.

description:
I drafted this review on January 11th, 2013:

Popped in tonight with my boo to check it out.

A honey milk green tea(light sweet) for each of us.

Honey flavor and tea/milk ratio were both good.

Tea flavor was just slightly over-brewed for my taste. You know the last cup of tea from the pot at a pho place - kinda like that. Kinda good, but not great.

Boba were better than most places. The sweetness of the boba was nice, but the consistency of the texture wasn't perfect. I like my boba to have a uniform chewiness, like a fruit snack. Some of the boba in my drink had a nucleus more chewy than the outer region.

Overall a solid drink. I'll be back.

*I have since been back numerous times. Most of the time drink flavor and boba texture are spot-on, but I have experienced some inconsistencies. Overall, a solid spot. They recently added new drinks (like Tea Cream and Honey Dew Milk Tea), as well as free wifi (untested).
author: Jeffrey D.

description:
When I crave for milk tea, it's either Purple Kow or Honey B.  I prefer this place because of the convenience and the line is way shorter than Purple Kow.

I personally come here for their tea creams.  Their matcha tea cream is quite refreshing and you can really taste the tea. I would recommend their roasted oolong tea cream because it's light in flavor and you don't get that bitter aftertaste that teas usually give. 

Their service is good and friendly, although you need at least $10 before you can use your debit card :( Another downside is that they have no available restrooms for customers and it is hard to find street parking at certain times of the day.

Overall, if you don't want to wait in line, Honey B is a great alternative to Purple Kow and their tea creams are really good! Just be sure to either bring cash or expect to buy more drinks than you can handle to meet their minimum debit/credit card requirement.
author: Jessica Mae T.

description:
Not much to complain about - Great alternative to Purple Kow if you can't afford an hour to wait in line. The drinks aren't as good but it's definitely worth the trade off. I think I've gotten ice milk every time I've been here and it does what it's supposed to do...1000 tasty calories in a cup that I can regret later.

Unfortunately for my body, we'll be back.
author: Con L.

description:
I came here several times since they've opened. It has never been that busy, but every single time I order my 1 drink, it takes forever. There was one instance when it was just another customer and I waiting for our drinks. I always order the most basic order. It still took them about 10 minutes to get my drink ready. This last time I ordered my black milk tea with boba and I sat down waiting for my drink. There were 2 workers, a family who already received their order, and a couple who seemed to have ordered themselves each a drink. They received their order and I saw mine was being sealed in the back. Then I saw my drink was set on the counter for someone to call my drink to be picked up. I'm staring at it and I'm guessing the 2 workers back there are cleaning up? I wait about another 3 minutes, I was already waiting there for 10 minutes. Finally I received my order. 

If the boba was amazing and the drink was undeniably unbeatable, I'd wait. I have waited for awesome drinks and food. Waiting for something that I don't need to wait for, when it's sitting in the back staring at me....I have a problem. The tea was ok, not overly sweet, but not much flavor in it. Boba was a tad too hard and not exactly chewy. I've definitely had better boba, tea, and service.
author: Christina L.

description: This place is either a hit or miss. Been here three times in the last week and some of the drinks were absolutely disgusting, for example, the mango milk black tea and the peach milk black tea. They were both super sour. Imagine the taste of sour milk. My favorite drink is the matcha milk tea and you can't go wrong with the regular milk tea. The Thai tea is decent. Just don't order anything besides the safe bets cause it does not mix well.
author: Maybo L.

description: It's a good alternative to Purple Kow. They have the caramel iced milk with boba. CALORIES BOMB, but so damn good. I went to Richmond nails, and Honey B is a block away!
author: Joanna S.

description: This place is a joke and rip off. Garlic fries and chicken nuggets $10+ and no garlic whatsoever, not even garlic powder! Wanted milk tea but I don't like the powder milk (which is all they have/use) so I ordered the watermelon slush drink w/boba.  Cost $5 and was nothing special. Went there at 2pm on a weekday but still had a long wait???  Still can't get over the garlic fries... I even asked him to be sure it was "garlic fries". Won't be back.
author: Victoria N.

description:
They get props for accepting cards and ample seating. However, their drinks are average. I usually get slush drinks and Honey Bee's are on the icy side and bland. 

They do have a big menu and offer snacks. I would come again and try their other drinks, but I'm trying to lose the chub! Also, there's usually a line. So don't expect to hop in and out. The drink prep is on the slow side
author: Lisa X.

description: Just not good enough , I have had a lot of teas but they s just tasted weird . Ordered the strawberry green tea from their specials selection , if that's their special I wouldn't wanna try anything else
author: Sreeram K.

description:
Hello, the key to continuing good business is to maintain or improve on your beverage offerings. Unfortunately since the last time I went to Honey B, I dropped by a again a few times to order several different items, hoping that with each time they screw up, I will be luckier the next. Boy, was I wrong.

Caramel+boba+pudding tea - OMG it was SO sweet that I brought it home, BREWED MY OWN TEA, and added it to the drink to make it drinkable. Seriously, when I said NOT to add anymore additional syrup, you don't amp up on the sweetness!! 0/5

Matcha green milk tea - I take back my previous review about how they don't skimp on the matcha powder, because now they are so stingy with it that you couldn't really taste the matcha 1/5

Boba+pudding tea - Not sure how different it was from the caramel version, because I could still taste the caramel without the crazy sweetness. Diluted, and boba was not completely cooked. Blergh. 1/5

Just yesterday, I stopped by to get the matcha green milk tea again. It was an utter disappointment. It confirmed my earlier experience that they were being a stingy bastard with the matcha powder again.

I'm just very frustrated with the lack of consistency, and their audacity to charge so much for their mediocre drinks. I make a trek out to Outer RIchmond time and time again just to relive that wonderful first experience, but I think they have fallen short every time since then. Plus, whoever that was manning the cashier just has the WORST attitude ever. They don't even try to be friendly. Just the "order your shit and let me get on with my day") I am very disappointed because I thought I found my regular good boba place.
author: Wendy P.

description: This is a usual favorite for grabbing snacks and boba with lots of options.  Despite having limited seating and outlets without a bathroom, it has better wifi than its competitors.  Plus, it's tough to find parking in the area unless at night.
author: Jenny L.

description: This place has good drinks. I usually get the mango green tea with boba or the grass jelly dessert with red beans (cold). The boba balls good be better. It's a bit too soft for my liking but again not bad. I would give it four stars but I think the drinks are a bit on the pricey side for my liking.  Also, I wish they could make the grass jelly dessert less sweet but they won't, I asked :/
author: Sara W.

description:
Honey B is my second favorites milk tea place beside Sharetea and you are way better than purple cow (Yupe!!!!) 
I normally order their iced tea with aloe and it is pretty good. Also their barley milk tea is my new favorite drink here, just tell them less sugar and you are good to go!!!  Oh....  popcorn chicken !!! Must order =]

If you are tried to wait at the huge line in purple cow, just stop by here. Never disappointed!!
author: Mavis L.

description: Came back closer to opening hours and their boba was so much better! I tried their other flavors and was super happy with my drinks each time. YAY for second chances!!
author: Hannah P.

description:
I love Honey B. Everytime I come here, everything I have gotten was DELICIOUS. It was so good I had to get on Yelp to write a review.

Then I saw it only had 3 stars. What?!! Usually my taste is perfectly in tune with yelp ratings. What happened?

So I went to Purple Kow bc others had recommended it just in case I had been mistakening mediocre boba for amazing boba. The PK ended up being horrible. (See my review of my adventure drinking 3 chub cups of boba there bc I couldn't believe how bad it was.)

Anyway Honey B, I am sold for life. I'm sorry I cheated on your briefly, I hope you will take me back.
author: Kimberly F.

description:
Drinks are okay, I like their oolong milk tea.
They have weird flavored teas like tomato, herb jelly flavor (its not jelly)

boba is no good. 

not a bad place to hang out though.
author: Erica L.

description: Their milk tea with pudding and honey boba are the best in sf! Reminds me of Half&half in LA. Best part is there's never a line, you get a frequent buyer stamp card for a free drink and the boba and pudding are always made perfect. They also give you options to have cups that looks like buckets or regular cups if you plan on driving so it'll fit in your cup holder. Highly recommend this place! It's the best boba in SF!
author: Judy N.

description:
A very meh place. Came here with a group of friends after dinner and we all ordered some drinks. I just got milk tea with Boba. 
It was alright, I've had better & worse..lol

The place is small, and there seemed like there was only 1 guy working...
Theres better tea places around.

Also, I'm not a fan of the giant cups..they dont fit into cup holders..lol
author: Timothy N.

description:
Went here yesterday night with some my girlfriend and her friends. Ordered a fresh mango drink while my girlfriend got a pudding milk tea with boba. The fresh mango was refreshing. The milk tea was ok, tasted just like tapioca express milk teas. Pretty empty near closing.

Must try? Could do better
Try again? as a quick fix only.
author: Thomas N.

description: I usually don't leave bad reviews but c'mon, your door sign says "Open", you're supposed to open at 12:00 noon and it's now 12:10 and still no one. Forget it.
author: Sandra C.

description:
went here on sunday after dinner to finally give it a try. They have a lot of selection and have some unique drinks such as Iced honey tomato. I got a grapefruit green tea iced no sugar. it was eh. They say they use real grapefruit which is a plus for them but I didn't really taste much of it or see the actual pulp at the bottom. It wasn't super great but maybe I picked the wrong drink. I was debating between the grapefruit slush though too. They don't have blended matcha smoothie though and when I asked, they were like we don't know how to make it... um ok

overall, eh. I prefer Purple Kow over this place for the inner richmond area.
author: Tao Tao W.

description:
For how close this place is to my house, it's a bit surprising at how scare I've been to this place. This place used to be the hang out spot for some of my old coworkers because seats were always available. 

Honey B is your standard bubble milk tea shop that has slightly pushed the boundaries of drinks, such as Green and Black Cream Tea, or Taiwanese Iced Milk Drink or Honey Tomato Drink. 
Their boba is a step up from places like quicky's and purple kow but I don't find it remarkable like T-pumps or Asha Tea House. If I need to satisfy my boba craving, Honey B is the place to go. 

I really enjoy their Taiwanese iced milk drink with pudding and honey boba. The milk drink is creamy and somewhat tastes like caramel. In the past, you were only given the choice of the fat cups (which used to be a huge craze, thanks to Half and Half in Socal) but I'm really glad that they provide you the choice to see the other cups, such as the tall sized and the regular sized cup!

Sometimes I really wish boba places would allow you to try a sample of their drinks. For instance, I love tomato juice. I'm REALLY curious to try the honey tomato drink but I just can't imagine how the combination of honey and tomato would taste good.. nor am i willing to spend nearly 5 dollars to satisfy my curiosity! Same goes for the Tea cream drink!
author: Jennifer W.

description:
I am addicted to tapioca drinks. 

I came here twice and got the Matcha green milk tea. It's so good :) I love how green tea tastes and the tapioca is also tender. The tapioca is not included in the price on the menu... it's 50 cents more on top of your drink (FYI). Not big of a deal... but other places usually include that in their prices. 

Their cups... (the annoying FAT cups that Purple Kow started).. what a stupid idea. I hope they change their cups back to normal because people need to fit these into their cup holders. I requested for the skinny cup so the nice lady switched it for me.... however... the lid does not allow you to poke a hole through the plastic. Fail. I had to drink my milk tea with the lid on the whole time while getting my nails done. whomp whomp.. 

-1 star for the cups..
author: Cara N.

description:
Don't expect help navigating the nearly 100 item menu. The customer service we received was abysmal. 
Matcha Green Milk Tea was weak in flavor. 
Most likely not coming back for more.
author: Geordie E.

description:
I came here the other night with my friend after we had dinner. The worker was really nice and gave us recommendations since we weren't really sure what to order. I got the Honey Milk Black Tea without any tapioca. It was good and not too sweet. I just hate that they come in the chubby cups; luckily, it actually fits in my cup holder. My friend ordered some sort of hot barley tea, which was surprisingly good. 

Heads up: It costs 50 cents to make an iced drink hot and to add toppings.
author: Kathy L.

description: Was walking in the area and noticed the Quickly was replaced by Honey B. I decided to give this place a try. The first thing I noticed when walked in was the chubby cups from Half and Half and PurpleKow. I tried their oolong milk tea and it was pretty good and tasted like PurpleKow's but the drinks here are a bit sweeter. The second time I came, I got the matcha milk green tea but it tasted a bit watered down and not much of the taste of tea but as soon as I drank half of it it literally tasted like water. I like the fact that this place has no lines unlike other places. Would come back later when the operations smooth out later.
author: Peter C.

description: I've been here numerous time, been coming since it opened. With boba, the texture is always a gamble, but for most part I enjoy it. Their egg pudding is excellent. Service is average. It's hard to describe the drink because my girlfriend always orders it for me. But without a doubt I love this place.
author: Timothy T.

description: I got the iced milk drink with caramel, coffee jelly and honey boba. I like sweet drinks so it was perfect for me. There was no wait and the server was really nice.
author: Ada W.

description:
Not bad, not bad! 

- Ice Milk w/ Honey Boba and Caramel: I asked for less sweet, but they gave me regular. WAY TOO SWEET. But good. 

- Barley milk tea: REALLY GOOD. Good chewy boba. 

Will most definitely be back.
author: Jen D.

description:
UPDATE 4/15: 

Came back somewhat recently and ordered something different for once. All I remember is that it had chocolate pudding. If anything, I could compare it to the one at Purple Kow that also has chocolate pudding in it. I'd rather get the one here since there's rarely any long lines. Anyway, the drink was amazing! I praise whoever made it that day lol.

//

I've only been here twice and on both occasions, the inside was really quiet with 1-2 other customers or none at all. Same cashier both times - I think it's her and some older woman (her mother? I don't know).

Interior is nice and simple, nothing flashy or weird color combos. I like their fat cups.

Their fries are so-so. My sister bought it for her young son, but if it were me, I would never buy it. I tried their popcorn chicken and it's good, but I think it's less flavorful than the one at Teaway.

Their teas are flavorful and not watered down-tasting. I've gotten honey boba with each order, but I could never taste it. My sister said she could, but maybe I'm already too used to the sweeter honey boba at Infinitea.

They have an extensive menu, a lot of Taiwanese drinks that I don't care for. I don't think I'll come here again though since they're a little on the expensive side.
author: Krystal C.

description:
ahhhh another WTF. why is this place rated so high?! I am so confused. Is it just because it is frequented by school children? Or is it because they 'let you pick your own tea'?

I came in here twice now, because I really wanted boba and was in the neighborhood. Both times, i was overwhelmed. so many things to choose from. (normally this isnt a problem for me; but when you can choose some things, and they dont allow you to mix and match; even if you're willing to pay extra.. I just dont get it) .. I even ask for a recommendation; but the kids dont speak english very well; so they wont recommend anything! 

ahhh. I am still trying to figure out why people like it so much. I will come back until I get sick of trying; or I find something that makes them worthy of their rating. (whichever comes first; i guess. ha)
author: Lisa N.

description:
I'm sitting here with my Jasmine green milk tea, and ask I can say is that I'm really satisfied right now! The Jasmine green milk tea is nice and creamy, but the tea still shines through.

I'm not a huge fan of boba, but I tried the boba and egg pudding in my boyfriend's milk tea.  I really liked the boba; it was nice and chewy without being mushy. The egg pudding had a great consistency (e.g. it wasn't hard, but it wasn't hard either) and flavor.

The cafe itself is nice and cozy. There's a few tables and stools by the window. Service was friendly and fast: I got my drink in a couple minutes.

Bottom line: would definitely come here again if I was in the area (p.s. try to take the muni here...parking sucks in this area)
author: Denise C.

description: Yummm. Too bad this place is a bit far from where I live. I'm in the mood for the half and half boba tea. I tried this place last month, shortly trying purple kow; at first I was hesitant because purple kow was just A-okay but i found that i really liked this place. Some people prefer their drinks to have thick consistency, however, I liked how the consistency was a bit diluted. It makes it easier to drink and taste. I can definitely taste the tea and the milk. The boba was also good! it was chewy and soft, with a bit of sweetness. Instead of having pudding in our drink, we substituted it with coffee jelly which made it taste even better. Their drinks are a bit pricey. I think it was almost 4$ for a drink. I was quite surprised, I'm so used to paying around 2 or 3 bucks for a drink.
author: Ngoc P.

description:
Came here for the first time today with my bf and also a friend after class. We walked in and there was barely anyone there with no line and the girl at the cashier was super friendly. I believe her name was Renna. 

I asked to try samples of their egg pudding and honey boba. And I ended up ordering a pudding milk tea but she suggested getting a milk tea with pudding. 

Paid $4 something for the huge drink (purple kow sized cup) and I was highly satisfied. She kept asking if what she suggested was good and it was! 

Good customer service and way better drinks than purple kow. Will be coming here more since my favorite... Verdes is all the way in mountain view.
author: Kat S.

description: Agghh they have hot grass jelly!!! I was recently in Shanghai and accidentally ordered hot grass jelly and was freaked out when I got it because it was warm/hot!! I've never had bubble drink that was hot LOL. But now I am a huge fan and so glad they have it. My friend ordered a traditional cold boba drink with lots of boba and jellies and caramel.. they have several flavors. Liked both of the items we ordered. And this place is cute! We'll be back!
author: Vol T.

description:
Not sure why the rating is so low. This place has one of my favorite milk black tea's. It's creamy and more milky than tea-like. If you're looking for great boba though, this may not be the place. Cost is around $3.50 and the size is already large.

There are a few small tables to sit here. There usually isn't a long line so the wait isn't too bad.
author: Derek M.

description: Everything was just ok. Boba was disappointing as the consistency varied from ball to ball. Some were softer on the outside than the inside. Also, these were a bit bland and not like the honey boba I've gotten used to getting from tpumps or purple kow. However, they have other add ons from pudding to grass jelly. Go here for a fix if you're in the area, but not worth making a special trip.
author: Judy C.

description:
Honey B is a new tapioca spot recently opened in the Outer Richmond, taking over from the old Quickly that's closed over a year ago. Weird, that all of a sudden new boba places are popping up around this 'hood (2 other similar new businesses are to open soon - Bambu on Geary by 25th, and Infini Tea on Geary by 20th).

I was pretty excited to try this and cam here with my bf while we walked our doggies one lazy afternoon.

We tried the regular boba milk tea and grass herb fresh milk tea (something new and adventurous sounding) and overall, the teas do their job, but nothing too extra special. The tapioca balls have a good texture and consistency. milk tea and grass herb tea taste good, perhaps a little on the sweet side. I do recall the gal at the counter ask you what level of 'sweet' you'd like, so I'd be sure to downgrade a bit next time. 

With 2 more neighborhood boba places opening soon within a 7 block radius, it'll be interesting to see how each fare! Let the competition begin.
author: Jing D.

description:
I like Honey B Tea House because it's definitely a few steps up from powder-based boba drinks, and their drinks come in chubby cups. I came in unsure of what to order (usually I just get a milk tea at boba places) and I asked the cashier what the difference was between the regular milk tea and royal milk tea. She said the royal milk tea had a bit of lychee flavor. Sold! Keep in mind, you can order your drink not sweet, or regular sweet. I ordered a royal milk tea with honey boba (regular sweet). The royal milk tea didn't have a bit of lychee flavor, it had a lot of lychee flavor. It didn't taste highly artificial but it was just too much for me. If you get this drink, you definitely shouldn't add lychee jelly unless you love lychee. The boba had a nice chewy texture. My bf got the iced milk drink with caramel, coffee jelly and honey boba (regular sweet) but with the caramel, you should probably just opt for not sweet. Usually when I have iced milk drinks, I feel like I'm eating melted ice cream with condensed milk but Honey B's version wasn't as intense which I appreciated.

There was no line when we went on a weekday in the late afternoon. The cashier was super friendly.
author: Maya S.

description: Has an interesting menu.  Though may not be the best, but it will do.  I had the crema lemon milk tea, and I was not a fan.  Though my hubster had the imperial black milk tea and that was good.  Oh, yeah you have to tell them you want boba, and they charge extra for it.
author: Mary B.

description:
Wondering if the new place compares to other boba places around the Bay Area, my friends and I decided to have a go at it.

I had the matcha green milk tea/jasmine milk tea and they were pretty prompt at getting my drink done. Probably took less than 5 minutes. As for the taste, you won't be tasting the artificial flavors like the one you get at Quickly's; you can actually taste the tea. I would have preferred mine to be a bit more sweeter/milkier tasting, but after a few sips, I got used to it and it tasted fine to me. Overall, the drink was alright; still doesn't beat places outside of SF; however, I'd choose this place over Purple Kow because of 1) the line/waiting time 2) better staple drinks (like regular milk tea/green milk tea). Unlike here, I could never get used to my drink from Purple Kow, no matter how many times I sip it.

As for the service, the girl working when I was there on Friday night was a dear! When my friends and I were chilling at one of the tables, the worker came out and basically asked the table next to us how their drinks were and if they had any questions about them. Besides Tpumps, who else asks about how your drink is? Definitely something rare in boba places around here. And then when my friends and I left, all the workers greeted us with a smile and a goodbye. Very, very sweet people! Because of their service, one more star is added and I'd love to come back and try another drink from them. Gah, I'm really a sucker for great customer service.
author: Kirsten H.

description: The drinks were too sweet. The drink gets tiring while you're drinking it so I think the size should be a little smaller. Thought it was going to be better. Probably not one of the places that I would go back to.
author: Vernice T.

description:
I would have given this place 5 stars if and only if their milk black tea did not taste like powder. I discovered this tea house on Yelp.com while looking through the 'New Businesses'  on the homepage. 

The reason they deserve 4 stars is because I have waited multiple times at Purple Kow and each time I waited, it took at least 30minutes. I've tried going at different times but to my dismay, they were always packed or took too long to make my drink.

At Honey B, there was no line and I tried the most commonly ordered drink (milk tea with boba). It came out in 5 minutes and the cup they used was very similar in shape to PK.

Food/Drink Highlight: Black Milk Tea with Boba and no line :P
author: Rich L.

description:
I waited a few minutes before the cashier emerged from the kitchen to take my order. I just awkwardly stood at the front wondering if one of the patrons were the employees and was too busy to care about me wanting to order. But alas! He comes out of the kitchen and takes my order.

I ordered Honey Milk Tea with boba and custard, but tell me why there was caramel at the bottom of my cup!!!

At first I thought it was "dark" honey... nope. It was caramel and it made my drink super sweet. I don't like super sweet milk tea. Sweet custard, I'll take it. Boba too soft, I'll take it, too, but when the tea's too sweet, it's just all bad.

Bad milk tea aside, the boba itself was good. Soft on the outside and just the right amount of chewiness in the middle.

Bottom line:  I'll stand in line for 2 hours for Purple Kow any day over Honey B.
author: Serinda O.

description:
Clean boba tea house, but feels somewhat incomplete with their empty cold storage displays. The upside is Purple Kow sized cups without the Purple Kow price or wait (under $4)! This place has the value! Unfortunately, it is still not without its issues. I ordered a Matcha green milk tea with boba. I love the size and boba, but the green tea isn't very Matcha. It's green tea for sure, but I don't get that Matcha flavor. 

Overall, this is a great value and a decent alternative to the bucket size milk teas.
author: Jeremy L.

description: Took 20 minutes to make my drink and I was the only one in there. The drink wasn't even good. I had to throw half the cup away because it started making me sick. Never again.
author: Cupcake s.

description: Boba here is decent, not bad at all. But if I had the option of going here or a little further down to Purple Kow, I would choose the latter. The selections are very similar to Purple Kow, but I must say other selections are definitely not something you see often on other menus. No wait whatsoever, the place is neat, pretty good.
author: Nancy C.

description:
They gave me enough ice to preserve a morbidly obese man. Unfortunately, I already dumped the body. (Disclaimer: did not actually kill anyone/dump a body, please do not come looking for me fbi D:)

The tea itself was pretty meh. I got the matcha green milk tea which was a little bit on the sweet side. They charged standard prices ($3.24 after taxes) but I felt a little ripped off because of the whole ice thing. Not sure if they charge for boba because I wasn't in the mood for it that day, so no comment on that.

It was pretty empty so the service was prompt! However, they ran out of quarters so I ended up getting like 9 dimes. Gross, loose change. orz

Not the best. Maybe I'm spoiled but I've had MUCH better for MUCH cheaper.
author: Andrew C.

description: Oolong Milk Tea (Light Sweet) - 3/5. Can't complain, it was average-tasting tea - not amazing, not terrible. Honey boba was well done though!
author: Gabriel C.

description:
My friends have been raving about "cremas" down in LA and how a crema can never go wrong. I'm a huge fan of boba drinks (heck, I work at one) and have never had a crema before. First time I came here was on a Sunday before my birthday after dim sum with my family. I was having a boba crave and this was the nearest place for boba. After looking through the menu, WHAT A SURPRISE! I spot "Milk Tea Cream". So i ordered the largest one possible to see if it lives up to what I've been hearing. They even have instructions on the wall to tell people how to enjoy it to the fullest. And boy, it did not disappoint. Came back again two days later on my birthday and got the same thing. I'm in love. Their cream on top is so fragrant and has a bit of a salty and tart flavor (I'm guessing the saltiness is from sea salt?). A huge plus, their milk tea is absolutely delicious too!

Side note: I tried my brother's mango yogurt. It was good too. Very mango-y and nothing artificial-like to the taste. Also recommended a friend to try their milk tea cream and she fell in love with it too :)

Minus one star for the poor unsmiling employee behind the counter. Good service = more tips. Perhaps I shall tip you next time when you smile?
author: Sandy F.

description: This place is such a knock off version of purple kow. Their pathetic attempt of an Ice milk, not to mention the tapioca was hard. Seriously? Gtfo of here.
author: Anh T.

description:
Delicious tea in HUGE cups for a low price. I had the Old Fashion Black Tea with small pearls and it was delicious. Not too sweet and the boba definitely had a fresh taste to it. 

Minimum $10 purchase when using a credit card!
author: Stephanie P.

description:
Few reasons I am giving it 3 stars. 

1) The milk teas are okay. I've had better. I like my milk teas stronger in tea flavor and this one doesn't cut it for me. But then again not a lot of places can meet up to my taste in milk tea. My favorite milk tea is the one you get from Chinese restaurants. There is just something about their milk tea that's so tasty. But this one does not cut it. It's one of ones that are close to my least favorite. There is one that I do like which is their HONEY milk tea. IT taste like the chinese iced honey lemon tea that you get from restaurants, and I really love that tea w/o the lemon :P So if I were to get a milk tea that would be one of them. 
  They also have a choice for red beans, green beans, or taro. I'm not a big fan of any of those, but everytime I Come with my sister or friends they usually get a drink with that stuff in it. I feel it caters to a more asian population, because not a lot of places have milk teas with red bean or green bean. And milk drinks too. When do you see a milk drink with red bean?

2) I love yogurt drinks. You don't find many places with yogurt drinks and I was happy that this place had it. The Fresh Orange Yogurt is good it has a bit of a tea flavor or herb flavor I can't really put my tongue on it, but it's good. I like it my sister doesn't like it, but meh she's not doing the review I am :). Their peach yogurt is so good. I love good peach drinks and the yogurt one is really really good. Their slushies look really good. I've never really gotten it, because i'm so hooked on their yogurt and milk drinks :P

3) Milk. I hate milk. If I eat cereal and there is milk left over I pour it into the sink. I DO NOT DRINK IT. IT IS GROSS. I HATE MILK. But their number 52, it's chocolate pudding, and tapioca milk drink. I love it. it's delicious it's not too sweet and not too not sweet(Does that make sense? :P) It is very hard for me to drink milk and want it again. And this place makes me want that drink AGAIN. Surprising I know! :P When you go to purplekow and you get their milk drink it taste like ice cream. Super sweet "super delicious" Well I only got it once and once was enough. A few sips of purplekow's milk drink and I get headaches and I never want to touch it again. But the one at Honey B makes me wnat to go back and I have a hard time trying to try new things at honey b, because I want that milk drink so bad! When I finish their drink and the choco pudding is left at the bottom i do'nt bother eating that up. The choco pudding w/o the drink is eh.. It doesn't really taste like anything except coco power. Little weird to me. 

Their tapioca IS DELICIOUS. I like my tapioca chewy and sweet. Some people might like it mushy or no tapioca at all. I'm a tapioca girl. I like tapioca. This tapioca is one of the best tapiocas i've had. They make it chewy but not too chewy and not too sweet. Ugh DELICIOUS. 

Their grass jelly is okay not a big fan. Doesn't have much flavor. Their litchi jelly is good. I don't usually get stuff other than tapioca so... I can't really say much about the other stuff.

Be careful with their sweetness. For me it has not been constant. Sometimes it's sweeter and sometimes it's not. I always get normal sweet I don't bother going less sweet or w/e. So just a warning if you do get regular sweet and come back another day it may or may not be exactly the same. But we're all humans we all do things a little different. It can't be the same all the time. 

TL:DR if you don't like milk teas but like yogurt drinks and milk drinks this is the place for you. AND it has more Asian flavors. So those of you who look red bean or green bean, or even taro this is the place for you.
author: Emily L.

description:
Came here on a Friday around 9pm and the place was not too packed.  

The service was not that great.  The staff was not friendly and no smile....

I got the Honey Green Tea with Boba.  The drink was to sweet.  I did not taste any tea and too less boba.....The boba was kinda overcooked, not chewy.

The place was neat and clean but the drink that I got was not that good.
author: Liza T.

description: Ordered the mango green tea with no sugar and with boba. Came out perfect. The boba was a bit soft but not bad. Would go again.
author: Andy B.

description:
I would be giving this place a 1 star if it wasn't a brand new business.  There is a reason why there is a line out the door at Purple Kow and no one in line here....but I am a sucker for trying new places.  

I ordered a fresh fruit grapefruit green tea and a lychee green tea.  I had to repeat my order 3 times and point at the menu before the person got it right.   The taste of both drinks were okay but half the cup was filled with ice.  

The biggest disappointment was the waffle eggs.  Even though they had 3 people working here, they didn't make the waffle eggs until the drinks were ready and I had to ask where my waffle eggs were.  That's when they proceeded to make it and almost 10 minutes after I asked, she handed me my waffle eggs completely soft and limp, with no taste whatsoever.  It felt like the batter was not completely cooked.  After tasting 2 eggs, I threw the entire order away.
author: Stella C.

description: Ordered #53 which is the Taiwanese milk tea w/honey boba, caramel, & pudding. The caramel they use is the same as one used at Starbucks so it's not too overly-sweet or burnt tasting (which I'm always weary about). The pudding is very soft as was the small boba that came in the drink. The milk tea had more flavor and in the entirety the drink was way better than Purple Kow. HIghly recommend!
author: Kitty K.

description:
after stuffing our faces.. i was too full but wasn't full enough to not have dessert! 
purple kow had a line out the door so we tried this place out

ordered:
-roasted oolong milk tea: grass jelly, honey boba
-barley milk tea: egg pudding, honey boba

loved both and would come back again if i was in the area
author: Raquel T.

description:
Came here cause i was thirsty and enjoy milk tea/boba places.
I ordered the lychee milk tea and also a green bean milk tea.
Took awhile to get but not compared to purple kow.
The lychee milk tea is pretty good, cold, but it taste like there's some powder substance or something. The green bean was disappointing because it was not cold, lots of boba but yea, tasted warm and not as good as it could be.
author: Hao B.

description:
It took so long to make a drink. 
Not really well organized, why dont they put number in orders? It would be easier for customers to keep tracking their drinks. 
In addition, the tea flavor doesnt make me feel natural.
author: Phuong P.

description:
Every time I come here..the place is empty. Not sure why because this place is actually pretty good! I usually get their Honey Green Tea Cream (which is sooo much better than ShareTea in San Mateo..no offense!) The creama and the green tea consistency is on par. If you like 7 Leaves in SoCal, then you'll love the Tea Creama here! Very good comparison. Also, the Iced Milk Drink is pretty good as well, i would much rather go here than wait in the long lines at Purple Kow. Also, if you're craving Half & Half in Socal, I bet you'll love the Iced Milk Drink here. Soo yummy and delicious! 

Only cons about this place is the popcorn chicken is not very good and they barely give you any. Also, this place is a bit pricey for Boba drinks, ranging $5-6 bucks. When I can just go to Tpumps or tea way and spend less than $5 bucks. Other than that, highly recommend the Tea Creama!
author: Julia K.

description:
Service was friendly and the tea was tasty. Standard serving size seems to be "bucket".

The shop was opened late, and it took way to long for my order to come out (she apologized and explained that it was because they were just opening). Seems like they need more staff, and to schedule an earlier shift start time.
author: Quinn S.

description:
I've tried the milk tea as well as the Jasmine green milk tea. The boba is good, and the tea is good even though it is slightly too sweet. 
One complaint is that they charge an extra 50 cents for a hot drink. I thought that was a little much because the drinks are already on the more expensive side.
author: Allison P.

description: Fuck this place. Takes forever to get a muthafukin drink...go to Quickly instead if you can. Fuck you!
author: John E.

description: This place is really good!! Better than I expected. Sweet girl working there too. But only downside there is a $10 minimum for debit cards and my drink was only $3 so I had to find an ATM on the next corner. :/ but I will for sure come back soon :)
author: Amanda D.

description:
Been here twice and both time the cashier has bad attitude ! Be honest, she has the worst attitude than all the boba places I have been to around this area.
I got the grapefruit slush with boba and aloe also a green tea milk tea with boba. Boba quality is good but the drinks was as good as expected. 
The services are slow and drinks are decent . Parking is usually easy to find around 3pm on a weekday.
author: Crystal W.

description:
Not bad, would go back.

Parking isn't the easiest but there was no line inside when we got in the store.
author: Doris L.

description:
Would give it a 0 star if I could. 

After waiting for over half an hour for 2 cups of tea, I got sea salt winter melon cream tea, except there wasn't supposed to be sea salt in it. I'm guessing they just didn't wash their container or blender and whoever they made the tea for before me really like their tea salty. Other than being surprisingly salty the 'tea' itself tastes disgustingly sweet. You'd think that if they spend that much time making the tea, maybe they'd at least brew it nicely. But nope. Just another one of the instant powdered chemical flavour thing mix with water. 

My boyfriend ordered mango black tea with boba. It was bitter. It was sour. He drank almost all of it and puke it all up.
author: Bobo V.

description: This place is okay.  Was really expecting more.  The boba was great and the service was really nice.  They checked in on us to see if everything was okay.  The boba was okay but it sorta just tasted like diluted sweet milk for me.  It wasn't super sweet, but didn't really have a strong tea taste either.  Maybe the taiwanese style tea is better, but didn't give that a try.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
I've tried a few of their drinks.  I like how you can choose the sweetness level you want.  I love the honey soaked boba, but they are heavy handed with the boba.  I like to ask for less boba and less sweet.  Especially if you get the caramel in your drink, ask for less sweet unless your a sugar junkie.  I enjoy the pudding's soft velvety texture.  They do not skimp on the add ins, and I am usually left with pudding at the bottom of my cup after the tea is gone.

There isn't a long line anytime we go and the service is pretty quick.  Prices seem about average and there is some seating available if you want to hang out.  We usually order and head back out.  I'm a foodie, but when it comes to milk tea, I am not a perfectionist.  I've tried purple kow and that didn't live up to the hype.  T-pumps in San Mateo has great tasting boba.  Wonderfuls has good almond milk and fresh watermelon slushes.  Do any of them stand out as being the best?  No and I would not wait 2 hours to just get a drink.  In that amount of time, I can go home, cook my own boba and brew my own milk tea for the same price as one drink.  I go to these shops for the convenience, not because I can't make it taste just as good.
author: Linda B.

description: Boba!! And dim sum too!!  I've yet to try the tea cream but one day when I'm not pressed for hunger and time.  There is always anlube because San Franciscans know yummy food.  I love that that there are choices too :)
author: brenda b.

description:
Service(cashier): 5/5
drinks: 3/5
atmosphere/decor: 4/5 
Expensive, will probably not come back. 

Came here on a weekend afternoon. It was pretty empty, maybe about 8 people total. The wait wasn't very long.This place is pricey for milk tea. Prices for regular milk teas here are about $3.00. Even though it was the fat cup, it wasn't worth the price. I'm more used to paying $2.00 for milk teas, especially if they are plain (no toppings at all). Good thing is they don't load the thing full of ice, so you are getting a good amount of drink.They didn't ask me for size, so I'm assuming the menu which says $3.00 is the size you get. They do have 3 sizes, but set prices are set on the menu. So I don't know how that works out. 

As for taste, nothing too spectacular. I wanted to try their cream teas, but I wasn't about to pay $4 for a cup. I think this can be a good hangout place. There is plenty of seating and it is very clean too. But probably not if I wanted to come here to just grab a boba drink and sit for a short time.
author: Cecile S.

description:
ugh..no.  It's like a bad imitation of Purple Kow.   

The grass jelly taste off
Boba was way too sweet
Roasted Oolong Milk Tea lacked flavor
Egg Puffs were hard and dense, and lacked flavor
The decor/layout is dated.

Not coming back, sorry.
author: Christina L.

description: After seeing the number of stars and reviews on this place, I decided to give it a try. However, I am greatly disappointed. I ordered a longan fresh milk tea, but there was no longan in the tea nor tasted any longan flavoring. I went to ask the employee if they had added any longan into the drink. He said yes, but I did not see any.
author: L Y.

description:
Came here just to take a break from having a baby boy and enjoy my time exploring the city. I remembered one of my friend went here and it was the same cup size Purple Kow uses in Balboa near my SF house. So Trying something different, I wanted to give it a try. 

It was good. The normal tapioca place. I came when they just opened, but i bet when kids are out of school, it's a good way to chill with your friends. Possibly a busy area to hang out probably knowing that it's always a popular place to go.
author: Gen M.

description:
They have egg waffles here! I was quite disappointed when my waffle came out a little on the soggy side. It should be more crispy!

The drinks here are pretty good!
author: Pao W.

description:
I'm always excited yet somewhat dubious to try new tea places, but Honey B came highly recommended by a friend, so we decided to give it a try.  Overall, I would give it a pretty solid 3 stars.  As in: it wasn't mind blowing or even sock rocking, but I would come back if conveniently close and be satisfied with the drinks.

I ordered the oolong milk tea, and my friend ordered the honey milk tea.  Both of them were pretty good but not as flavorful as other places I've been.  We also ordered less sweet, and they were still plenty sweet (so I'm a little afraid to know what regular sweet tastes like).  We also ordered the egg puffs, which were tasty, but the consistency was a little disappointing because instead of being light and airy, they were dense and chewy.  However, if your craving egg puffs, these will still hit the spot.

Overall, solid tea experience.  I would come here if I happened to be nearby, but i would not go out of my way to seek out Honey B.
author: Carrie C.

description:
I'd say the milk tea itself is about a 2, but the egg puff and the soft boba bump it up to a 3.  As I've mentioned before, I absolutely love boba, so I was excited to try this new place.  I'd heard pretty good things about it.  Came here with a group of friends and ordered the royal milk tea with boba.  The portions are very similar to that of Purple Kow (same fat tubs), so yay for that.  Overall, the tea was very underwhelming.  It tasted almost watery - the tea flavor wasn't strong enough, nor was the "royal" milk tea that I'm used to.  We also ordered an egg puff, and although it doesn't measure up to Eggettes, it was still yummy.  Nicely crispy on the outside and a little chewy on the inside.

Not too bad, but definitely would hit  up other boba places before coming here again.
author: Can C.

description: I have been coming to this place for my Boba fix every time I visit my in-laws who lives on Clement and 23rd. Lychee Green Tea with Boba is the BEST- the drink is not too sweet(like most of other places) but has a pure tangy taste that is very soothing that reminded me the the slogan from a Sprit commercial "obey your thirst". If you are in the Richmond neighborhood you have to stop by Honey B to try out their Green Tea flavors. I took one star off because the wait usually a bit long.
author: Wayne H.

description:
Honey B isnt bad but its not amazing i would actually give it 3.5 Stars!

purple kow's competition pretty much in the richmond district b/c its the same size as purple kow's drink and pretty close/maybe cheaper priced. 

i had honey green milk tea which was good not amazing but good so it passed my test, part of me is gonna stick to simple milk teas from this place just like i do with purple kow's drinks.

this place is open till 11, pretty good seating/decor, and doesnt have a enormous line out the door which is great in my view. 

ps. its located on the CORNER its really easy to drive by it without noticing you did!
author: Matt F.

description: five star for its wonderful flavor，though the speed is a little bit slow. my first choice would be the milk tea drink，with boba absolutely！
author: Yue K.

description:
Get their strawberry pudding and honey boba Ice Milk Drink, number 64. lol. Its a mouthful to say, but so delicious. the strawberry pudding, which is just strawberry syrup and sugared (real) strawberries is what makes it so tasty and better than Purple Kow's ice milk drink. I was a die-hard Purple Kow Ice Milk-drink fan, but Honey B has made me change my allegiances. when you get the drink the strawberry "syrup" is all trapped in the bottom of the cup. stir the drink completely (or not, to your preference) and the drink will taste like delicious strawberry milk ^^

I'm not sure why Honey B has three stars, but the not-a-fan reviews seem to be from when Honey B first opened.I'd give them another chance, they seemed to have pulled themselves together.
author: Vicky T.

description: I personally believe their milk teas are much tastier than Purple Kow. Purple Kow's is watered down and it tasted bland. Prices are reasonable.  Food is good and I def recommend trying the fried squid legs (for seafood lovers like me). Service is slow. Almost as if they have to harvest and dry their own leaves to make their teas. Restaurant is clean. Accepts major credit cards for purchases $10 or more. Has a stamp card promo of 10 stamps = 1 free drink.
author: Michelle G.

description:
They're not bad, although I can't account for the milk drinks. The drink I normally get is  the Taiwan style iced milk drink with chocolate, pudding and honey boba. It's pretty interesting and tastes pretty good. Also, their cups are huge. Like the ones at Purple Kow. 

Also, most of the time there aren't any lines and its got a pretty good atmosphere.
author: Samantha Y.

description:
2.5 stars

This place just newly opened and is on trend with the ginormous cups! Cute little name and it's right at the corner of the block.

- Minimal seating inside, not much for decor but good for a grab and go.
- Quick moving line

I had the honey milk tea. Just tasted like a sweetened bubble milk tea. Nothing extraordinary with the flavoring and just was a bit too milky for me. The taste of the tea was not very strong. There is nothing wrong with it, but there's nothing great about it. Just average. Especially with trying my friend's regular milk tea, and some other sweet flavored tea yet all the flavors seem too similar.

The quality and the taste to me, resembled a quickly's if you ask me.. 

Preferably CASH. 
$10 credit card minimum.
author: Tiffany N.

description:
Heard about this new boba place and had to try it. Their cups are just like the one at Purple Kow. 
No line first of all. I ordered their macha green milk tea and my sister ordered their strawberry yogurt. They were delish! These cups are pretty big. Not sure how many ounce but you sure get enough. 
The girl even asked if we wanted to customize the sweetness which was nice. 
I would come back whenever I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Smiley H.

description:
My to go place when the line at purple kow is long ! I'm really lovin their fat cup & logo. Anyways, first time I came, I got myself a honey milk green tea and its good.  However, the tapioca is a lil hard. The second time I came back I tried their caramel milk tea & it's on point as well.

Service is fast & the place has good ambiance. A perfect place to chill after a long day . 

Definitely trying their other drinks next time!
author: Mary U.

description:
Been here twice. I've ordered their passion fruit iced tea and hot milk tea. The iced tea was had a bitter taste which I like but my mom didn't care for it. The second time I ordered a milk tea, it's .50 more and much smaller than ordering it iced (hence don't get it hot, you lose out on quantity) 

Not many food items to order from, they have egg custard tarts for $3.20 but you might as well walk a few blocks down to Lung Fung and get it for .90. 

It's an ok place to get work done if you don't mind the sounds of blenders or people walking in and out. There are two sockets towards with the back with four plugs in them. No bathroom available in the cafe so you'd have to walk across the street to the theatre and see if they'll let you use their bathroom.
author: Crystal M.

description:
My friend introduced our friend, her cousin, and myself to this fairly new boba place. Omg, it's good. Caramel, pudding, boba milk tea. Still doesn't beat Purple Kow, but it's 2nd! (: I'm happy that their boba are soft, unlike places back home. 

One problem I have with ordering boba or extra stuff in my drinks is that I can never finish it. But no complaints.

I'm coming back here. Yay for San Francisco milk tea places!
author: Josephine C.

description: Everything is fried and all of the food taste like it came straight out of a freezer and it's too chewy and gross. The boba tea is good though
author: Dylan R.

description:
I got the Milk Tea drink.  

If you like a boba drink that takes more like tea than milk, then this is the drink for you.  The boba wasn't consistent though.  Some felt like they were not thoroughly cooked and there were others that were perfect.  

It was cheap for the size of the drink.  The Milk Tea only cost $3.78 and is the same size as Purple Cow's

EDIT: The Taiwanese Style Milk drinks are really sweet. and I really like that, especially when there is egg pudding in the drink.  Sometimes I just get the egg pudding instead of boba because it is that good.  You can choose less sweet, regular, or extra sweet depending on your preference.
author: Jeremy H.

description:
$10 min on credit cards, FYI

After reading some of the reviews prior to coming here I was somewhat iffy about the whole situation because a friend of mine posted some pics and what-not when they first opened and I'm really happy they finally turned what used to be Quicklys into another tapioca shop. I had lunch in the neighborhood and thought I should come by and check it out.

This store is kind of small or a little tight, perhaps, despite being on a corner. I came in and thought there was a line but there was actually only 1 other in front of me and about 5 or so other customers already waiting for their drinks. The customer in front of me took a while to order but no biggie I suppose and when I went up to order, it took no more than 1 minute to make my order: two matcha green milk tea (jasmine milk tea/green milk tea) and one honey green tea all with tapioca. When I got my order number, apparently there was about 8 other customers ahead of me so the store was probably crowded a bit from all the people waiting. Oh boy, was this really going to be happening again like Purple Kow? OH YES IT WAS~!

I think it took about 15-20 minutes before I finally got my drinks and I was watching just about all 8 customers or so that were before me leaving out the door slowly. There was about 2 workers in the back making the drinks and 1 cashier who eventually went to the back to help out since no more customers were arriving but it was still slow...so what exactly was going on? I was able to see that they were actually making each drink individually upon ordering, which probably was the cause of why they were so slow. They had the blenders working in the back and had to rewash them each time they made a new drink so things were just going by kind of slow. I didn't see the whole "half a cup of ice" going on, they had about a third or less cup of the ice and blended it down to make it crushed ice (I like crushed ice way better than whole ice personally). Their tapioca is chewy and good; not hard in the center and they give a decent amount of it. Their cup sizes are basically the same as Purple Kow, except on their cup, they have a sticker on it rather than a print.

When I finally got my drink I can tell by taste it wasn't the premade stuff but I can't say it's the freshest milk tea I've had because I've had others that were a lot more fragrant and distinctly clear tasting. For green milk tea, this was on the sweeter side and reviews from the honey green tea was that it wasn't sweet enough (even thought I didn't try it myself). Although I didn't have to wait as long as I did at Purple Kow (with its excruciating line), this was still a pretty long wait for a place that had less customers than there so I'm not going to super bash them about the wait time. The store is kind of stuffy but I think since they're new they're still trying to work out the quirks and what-not I bet. Their tea isn't cruddy like the chain stores like Quicklys but I can't say it's fantastic so it's a 3-star for now. If they can somehow speed things up (maybe like Tpumps, for a tiny shop they also have large cup sizes but come out really fast), I'd raise the score if I come back. Hope things work out for them.
author: Judy C.

description:
Finally! A decent boba place where I don't have to wait for over an hour for a cup of milk tea. 

Ice milk drink with honey boba, less sugar --- usual order. I like their ice milk drink better than purple kow. You can get sick of drinking it way too much, though. 

Can't wait to come back!
author: Tessa A.

description: This place is a-ok. I ordered a regular milk tea with boba, and it was a total of $3.23. I instantly got my drink a few minutes later, so that's good since the wait isn't too long. When I finally took a sip out of my drink, well, I liked the taste of the honey in my drink, however, I didn't like how it tasted so watery. The boba was alright! I MIGHT return to this place if improves.
author: Cara H.

description: I ordered 3 deep fried items and I had to wait over 30 mins. You must be kidding me because it wasn't that busy. They either forgot about our order or they are just really slow. I don't know how management works at this place but they should hire more employees.
author: Lubin T.

description: This is one of the better boba places in the city. You can actually taste the tea in the drinks, and the boba is always cooked to perfection (chewy, but not too tough). Probably one of the best places to get traditional black milk tea. Sometimes their drinks take ages to come out, especially if you order a snack on the side. And if you're in the mood for a snack, the French fries are delicious (my guilty pleasure - they taste similar to McDonald's fries :p ).
author: Felix C.

description:
Not bad at all.  I must concur, there was NO LINE when I walked in.  I had an ice milk w/red bean and honey boba and I added grass jelly.  Flavor of the ice milk is a little bland and not as sweet as purple kow.  With the red bean it was actually really good (it tasted like a red bean dessert I used to get in Hong Kong)... 
Sister had iced honey tomato with lychee jelly.  I thought it tasted a kinda weird, it had a sour after taste, I wasn't a fan.  Honey black milk tea was also bland... 
Kudos for the ice milk w/red bean!
author: Yukio W.

description:
This was my absolute first time having a boba milk tea and my tasty expectations were met. I had a honeydew milk tea and my brother had a banana smoothie. He liked it so much that the very next morning he asked me if we could go again.

The cashier was nice and friendly, but it was a little bit unpleasant when he didn't catch the banana smoothie order. About 5-10 minutes after I got my tea, I realized something was up, so I had to go up again to order the smoothie. I'm not too bothered by this. It was a little mistake. But I really hope it doesnt happen again.

All in all, the beverages we had were tasty and satisfying. Honey B Tea House is a cute shop. I will most likely go back there in the future ...unless the world ends before that of course ...O_O.
author: Hannah M.

description:
Honey B took over the old Quickly's location. This location hasn't had much luck in the past, so I hope Honey B fares well!

We tried the egg puffs and they were all right. It definitely has room for improvement. It was too doughy and needed more time on the machine. The flavor was subtle. It looks like they are gonna add more to their menu...I saw some crepe machines in the back!

Their cups are the same size as Purple Kow but its wait is definitely less than Purple Kow. We ordered the jasmine matcha milk tea and the red bean milk tea. The jasmine matcha milk tea was quite fragrant and had a hint of matcha. I prefer Purple Kow's fresh matcha milk tea, but if you like the jasmine tea as the base of the milk tea, then I'd say Honey B is pretty good. I like the fact that they use real red bean in their drink. Very few places make red bean milk tea the way I like it... Tpumps comes pretty close though. I liked the strong tea taste in the red bean milk tea. These beverages are definitely not watered down and you can definitely taste the tea. One gripe is the amount of ice... I hope they improve on this aspect. It's way too much ice!
author: Jay Z.

description: I'm a milk tea person so I only try milk tea drinks at Honey B. Their Oolong milk tea is very good. They can also make most of their drinks hot for the cold days in SF.
author: Prinya W.

description:
I like this place. Been here twice. The first time, I ordered a peach slush. The cup is super tall, but it had a lot of ice. Tasty, but I felt a little ripped off for the price. My friend ordered a milk tea, which was pretty standard--nothing too extraordinary. The boba is delicious, though. 
Today I came back with my friend since Bambu was closed (as it always is on Tuesdays). I forgot exactly what I ordered, but it was chocolate flavored and had pudding and boba. It was DELICIOUS. (I ordered it with regular sweetness) My friend ordered a grass jelly drink with aloe instead of boba. It tasted like it came straight out of the can, and it probably was. A lot of what was in the big cup was ice. 
Honey B isn't as cheap as Teaway or Quickly, but it's not bad to try if you know what to order.
author: Lissa D.

description:
Busy bee.

They need more staff. Ten minute wait for tea is not cool.

Why is the wait so long? Myself and others were waiting for things like a very sweet and likely very sugar-laden house black tea with honey.

Brain said don't you dare. Brain occasionally gets overruled.

If there was ever an appropriate time for design accents this is it.

Enjoy the sugar rush.
author: Jason B.

description:
the milk teas are alright. nothing special. comparable to quickly's milk tea. but their customer's service SUCKS!

I ordered barley milk tea from them, thinking it's made out of barley tea, but it had actually barley chunks in them that tasted like wood. The milk tea was disgusting. I asked the cashier if they could sift the barley pieces out. She goes "sorry we're too busy atm" and she goes back talking to her friends. LIKE SERIOUSLY???? You are not busy, only BUSY TALKING TO YOUR FRIENDS! I threw the drink in the trash and walked out. Never coming here again. SERIOUSLY THE WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE! even quickly has better service!
author: Winne L.

description:
What there's a new tea house within acceptable driving distance?! Lets go!!

Stopped by Honey B last night to sample their drinks. From reading the reviews I was dreading a long wait, but it only turned out to be a 10min wait. The selection of drinks is similar to Purple Kow, and I ended up ordering a honey milk tea with boba, and a ice milk drink with pudding and boba. Drinks were around $4 each. 
When it comes to my boba drinks, I actually don't mind it being on the sweeter side. I know that people sometimes complain about the lack of tea taste, but if I wanted that I'd honestly rather make myself a pot of tea at home. So that said, I found the drinks at Honey B to be decent, wasn't watered down or too powdery at all. The ice milk drink reminded me of half and half in LA. I would say that the only disappointment was the tapioca. They were too soft and had no texture. For any tea house, getting the tapioca right is a must. 
Overall, I do think that there will be improvement over time, since Honey B is newly open. As I've pretty much boycotted Quickly, and the ridiculously long lines at Purple Kow have prevented me from returning ever since my first few visits, I would say that Honey B Tea House is a welcomed addition.
author: Helen Y.

description: Don't know why the reviews are so bad. This is honestly one of my favorite boba places in the Bay Area. The milk teas are very creamy and yummy and boba is soft and sweet, and you can add egg pudding!!!!!?!? There's also no wait. So yeah, stop waiting at TPumps or Purple Kow, come here! No wait and tastes better than both of those overrated boba places!
author: B H.

description: We had the Matcha, Regular Milk tea and Sweet Potato Fries and they were really good. I thought the milk teas were better than Purple Kow's. The atmosphere here is nice and clean. But the cashier is such a mood killer. He seemed he was irritated for some reason but that's not an excuse to be unfriendly to your costumers.
author: Sara S.

description: This is such a cute little spot! The drinks are freshly made and this is a welcome addition to the neighborhood after the demise of Quickly. There were a few kinks in ordering and we were told we would have to wait an hour for pudding, but it's fine - they only just opened today, I believe. The girls working today were really nice and gracious.  We will be back to try the rest of the drinks.
author: Veronica C.

description: I am so disappointed with everything. Ordered almond milk tea and grass jelly honey boba and two orders of salt and pepper chicken. First the grass jelly honey boba did not have any grass jelly in it. Wtf. I didn't notice til i got home because they put it in the bag. It just taste like plain milk. No flavor at all. The almond milk tea just tasted like almond water. Very strong taste of almond though. The chicken look and taste like it wasn't cooked. Its all soggy and not even crispy. Everything was just plain nasty. I ended up throwing everything away. Waste of my $15. Ugh would give it a 0 star if possible. Probably would never come back here again.
author: Debbie Y.

description: Good tea and great service.  Guy working the register is very friendly and hands me my frequent customer card back with two hands and bows his head down.  Soooo polite!!!
author: Mason W.

description: I really like #60, the iced caramel with pudding and honey boba. I have been to Half and Half in LA, where I was first introduced to it, and also at Purple Kow, but this is my favorite rendition. It's very sweet, but just sweet enough to where it's not too sweet. The boba is a great texture - chewy but not undercooked or too hard and I like the pudding. The pudding is thin and I probably would enjoy it more if it were thicker (like at half and half), but the milk and boba make up for it. I like Half and Half but I don't feel it's sweet enough and I think Purple Kow's is so rich and decadent it's a bit too much for me so Honey B's is the perfect middle ground. Their regular milk tea is good too!
author: Sophia D.

description: This line is so much shorter than purple kow and their service wasn't too bad either.  We accidentally ordered the wrong thing, so I can't give a true testament of my visit here.  However, the boba was really good--perfectly chewy and contained just the right amount of sweetness.
author: Kristen T.

description: Horrible service.  Ordered one drink at 4:15, 30 minutes later asked if they lost the order. No, still working on it.  He then serves 2 people who came in after us!  I asked for refund cause we were late for practice.  Said they were making my drink.  It took 45 minutes for 1 drink.  We could have gone to a sit down restaurant and had a meal. Never will go there again!
author: Sylvia A.

description: Ordered mint milk tea with boba and it tasted stronger than Altoids or cough medicine. Spoke to the cashier and asked to water it down. It tasted the same. I ordered another one and asked them to throw away the mint tea. No apology, no discount, whatsoever. I am not coming back. I would recommend Bambu than this place.
author: Dasisters D.

description:
This place is decently clean and they are pretty good about customizing your order.  The drinks are on the sweet side.  I ordered a milky drink with pudding and caramel.  I regretted adding the caramel, but the pudding was good.

Each time I come here, the cashiers have been friendly.
author: Jen G.

description:
I ordered taro milk tea with honey boba and egg custard ($4 + .50 + .50). I was able to specify black or green tea and the drink actually was made with REAL taro and taro bits. The cup was huge and a la Half-n-half style. 
I ordered regular sweet (choices are extra, regular, less) but found the beverage not sweet enough; this lack of sweetness could be for this specific drink only. The taro flavor was very weak despite the taro bits and the drink tasted mostly of watery milk tea. I think having a taro milk option (no milk tea) could give more flavor, as I personally think on a flavor level taro milk tea only works well with artificial taro powder. 
The cashier was nice though and seeking customers' inputs on how their drinks tasted so they could be trying to improve.
author: C W.

description: I can't say anything about the tea creams (I was too intimidated to try... next time I guess), but +1 for chubby cups. Their fresh juices (watermelon) were refreshing, the boba is soft, and the odd combination of red bean and grass jelly (a suggestion of one of the workers) worked remarkably well with the sweet "Taiwan style" milk tea (#39? I recommend it). It might even be *too* sweet for some, but I enjoyed it. It had almost a caramel-like taste to it, and was not too saccharine. The people behind the cash register might not be able to help you with your choice too much (unless you can speak some Chinese), but they were nice enough. A pretty good dessert after a satisfying meal at PPQ just down the street, or something to hold you over as you wait hungrily for your meal at PPQ to begin.
author: Allie Y.

description: Ehh. It was ok. Nothing to rave about but nothing to complain about either. The boba here is pretty good though, nice and chewy but not too sweet.
author: Sarah L.

description:
After trying Tpumps, Quickly and Tea Way, this is a definite winner! 
The milk teas were a perfect blend of creaminess and tea and the boba was really good too. I was skeptical about trying the mint milk tea but it easily became a favorite (I usually like to order milk teas at places like this so I'm comparing this to other milk teas). Compared to other places, this one had the best quality and tastiest flavor. After trying different places with my friend, we agreed that this one was easliy our favorite!
Very friendly staff, although she took a bit too long to make our drinks (if you consider less than 5 minutes long, which compared to the 45 min lines at Tpumps, isnt too bad in my opinion)
Very cute little cafe, with more room to sit and very clean.
Also, they take cards! Yes!

Overall, best milk tea I've found in the area!
Definitely will be coming back as a regular customer
author: Margo F.

description: Imperial Milk Black Tea = YES.
author: Jennifer C.

description: It's better to order half sugar... Otherwise it's gonna be super sweet!!! I ordered a grass jelly boba milk tea. I love it except for too much sweetness. I'll come here again if I come to SF next time
author: Vic H.

description: This boba place is not bad for jasmine green tea. I can taste the tea and I think it is a bit on the sweeter side for me.  I have not yet tasted their tapioca balls yet.  Would not mind coming back to try it or the milk pudding tea.  The cups are like purple kow size and a bit pricey for toppings like grass jelly.  $10 credit card minimum though
author: Ann L.

description:
Tried this place per a friends recommendation. Now it's officially off my list of return spots. 

Pros:
-No crowd at the time
-Enough seats for the 8 of us to sit together (This place isn't that big so I am sure it is a hit or miss with seating)

Cons
- Boba (the main component of Milk Tea!) was more durable than one would like. Most of my friends didn't even finish their boba as it sat at the bottom of their cups. 

-Taro drink = red bean drink with taro? My friend who recommend this place was with me and her drink was confusing to herself. It tasted like a mix of red bean and taro, which is not what she asked for. 

-Matcha Green Milk Tea = a completely different order! My drink ended up being a Milk tea with caramel and I think taro. While that drink was fine, it was obviously not what I ordered. I didn't make them change it as they got really busy and didn't want to make a scene over milk tea. (It's not the end of the world)

-Communication - most Milk Tea places write something on the cup. A name, the actual drink order (how crazy!) but not here. They need to invest in a sharpie to avoid confusion on orders. What if I was allergic to caramel?!?

Overall this was an alternative to the always busy Purple Kow, however it's not worth the detour there unless you're in the area. 

Good try Honey B.....
author: Andrew B.

description: Since it opened, I wanted to see what the hype is all about.  Bottom line: I'd go back. The cup size is a little weird.  Good thing I was walking, instead of driving (cuz then how would I stash it in my cupholder? #firstworldproblems fo sho). I got the peach black tea - Not really used to the floating pieces of "fresh fruit" while slurping down the boba, but I guess I can get used to it. Still pretty sweet for it being black tea.
author: Denise H.

description: I ordered the milk tea with pudding. The milk tea was decent (good but no wow factors) but the pudding pieces were so big, I couldn't suck them using my straw. I even tried cutting them up using my straw but failed (why did it have to be so difficult?? I just wanted some pudding!). I didn't eat any pudding until the very end. Lame.
author: Rosie W.

description: My brother brought home a green milk tea with macha since he was in the area. "The claim to fame" of this place is their honey in their boba. Their big purple kow/half and half sizeed cups machine was broken so they had a ~20 oz beverage for 2.89 with boba. The tea was around the same quality as quicklys. Their was significant amounts of ice at the end of my beverage which is big no no in my book. Overall, I  would rather wait 1 hr at purple kow then go to this place.
author: Robert Y.
