description: If you don't want to wait in the line at pkow, this is an okay alternative. I like the tea at pkow better, but this place is good if you want to get the drinks right away and don't want to drive as far. I tried the barley milk tea and it threw me off because there's a decent amount of crushed barley in it - it tasted like oatmeal. i also added honey boba but didn't taste much honey. they might still be working out some of their kinks but i think it's a decent, hassle-free option to have in your back pocket to satisfy your boba cravings.
author: Susan C.

description:
Love the honey boba milk, which is about the same as Purple Kow, but in a plus side, Honey B doesnt have to wait in a long line for just a milk tea. 
however, parking is same bad as Purple kow. 

anyways, will definitely go back~!! great place..
author: Annie H.

description: I like the iced milk and oolong milk tea here better than the ones at Purple Kow.  They also have the less sweet option.  The size is the same as that ofPurple Kow and the prices are comparable.  The green tea drinks are also great.  They also have honey boba! There is usually no line which is great.  I will definitely be back to try their other drinks.  I hope they started their loyalty stamp card system by now.
author: Jennie W.

description:
nothing really stands out about this place. just a regular boba location.

Tea was pretty good, and the cups are nice and big too. the location is convenient although the inside is a bit small. i would say it's more of stop-and-go type of place as opposed to somewhere you can hang out with your friends.
author: Matthew S.

description: Great when you want a creamy milk tea without having to wait at Purple Kow.  With that being said, this place is truly a knock off of Purple Kow.  Not as good though, because of their hard boba and hard coffee jelly.  Needs a bit more froth to the Taiwan Ice Milk, and boil your boba and jellys longer and you'll be on par with Purple Kow.
author: Ralph L.

description: I stumbled on this place and was excited to find a new boba place in the hood. I ordered the longan milk tea, lychee green tea, and a lychee tea (not all for me). I paid close to $4 a drink and it turns out they did not use real longan in my drink. The young woman at the counter told me they use syrup instead.. so disappointing. Since it is a new establishment, they did not have any stamp cards available yet. I heard the other two drinks were not that good either and it took a good 10 minutes for my drinks to be ready even though we were the only ones in the store. I hope they get better when business picks up but I will stick to my other boba store favorites.
author: Kelly C.

description: One Boba place closes another one opens up in the same place.  This location used to be Quickly's.  There's a lot to choose from on the menu but the drinks are just ok.  I went in there on a Sunday around noon.  Can someone say slow?  Not slow like no customers slow, I mean they make drinks unbelievably slow.  From the time I ordered it took them 25 minutes to just get my drinks to me.  I don't know what was going on.   Maybe they were low staffed?  25 minutes is unacceptable.  If I'm waiting 25 minutes for a drink it better be the best damn boba I've ever had in my life and it better make panties drop when I take a sip.  Only time I might go back here is if I'm craving something and don't want to go far since I live like a block away.
author: Terrence L.

description: Good backup option to Purple Kow if you don't want to wait in a long line. Don't get the egg puffs.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Came here to try the honey boba I've been hearing about.  Unfortunately I never got to really taste it because when I received our drinks, the cashier ended up giving us small boba instead of large boba.  The texture was good, but it's not exactly easy to mess up cooking small boba...  And trying to taste a baby boba is like trying to taste a rice grain.  May consider returning to try again, but the other mess up in our order is what makes me hesitant --
My friend ordered a mint black milk tea (also with the large honey boba that was not meant to be), but it tasted, and looked, like a standard jasmine green milk tea.
Wrong tapioca, wrong drink?  And we had to wait 20-30 min.  I'll give it the benefit of the doubt with two stars since at least it was clean and we got to sit at a table while we waited.  Until then, I won't be going out of my way to come back anytime soon.
author: Angela T.

description: I just came here with the wifey and we were pretty impressed. We stopped by purple kow but didn't want to wait in an 1+ hour wait. Came here with no line and ordered. I got the oolong milk tea with half sugar and she got the barley milk tea with half sugar. Little annoyed they charge 50 cents for hot drinks but that is the same at purple kow too. Oolong milk tea was nice and fresh tasting. I actually could have used a touch more sugar but probably better I don't. My wife liked her barley milk tea, especially the real pieces of barley in the tea. It didn't taste artificial like other places. The prices are reasonable 2.98 for each drink and they give you a good sized cup. I think they learned and put less ice in my drink as I didn't feel half of it had ice. This is a very good alternative to purple kow as it is cheaper, no long wait and the tea is fresh tasting. I hope this place doesn't get too crazy and we have hour long waits here.
author: Derrick W.

description: Finally a real bubble tea place near our home.  Before had to go all the way to 3rd Ave and Clement for Quickly tea.  The bubble tea here is great.  Made from real tea and not the powdery stuff.  Really glad this place is here now although it would be nice if they have little snacks that can accompany the teas.  They only have the waffle eggs.
author: Jeannie L.

description:
Honey B is now my new favorite boba tea place! I came from LA and used to go to Half and Half all the time. Honey B is the closest alternative in San Francisco (Half and Half still the BEST).I hated the long lines at purple kow especially during the weekends. I also think it was ridiculous how my drinks at purple kow were always EXTREMELY sweet even when i ordered 1/4 SWEET!!!

I love the Taiwan Style Milk Drink with Grass Jelly and Honey Boba + light ice half sweet!
author: S H.

description: My friend and I decided to try out Honey B Tea House since it was the talk recently. My friend didn't even noticed the place until I told her where it was. The place isn't too big. It is pretty small, but it had a really nice atmosphere. My friend and I decided to get the jade lychee with boba. The drink came with lychee jelly which is great, but the taste is a little bit sour and sweet at the same time. Not really fond of it but I would mostly definitely come back to try their other flavor. It is cheaper then purplekow that is for sure.
author: Yannie C.

description:
This place has some of the worst service I've received in my life. We ordered 2 drinks and an egg puff and, despite there being very few people there when we ordered, it took them over 20 minutes to make our drinks and an ADDITIONAL 30 minutes for the egg puff (which was extremely soggy when we received it). To add insult to injury, the employees were not at all apologetic for the poor service. We didn't even receive one 'sorry' from them. 

Bottom line: There are plenty other tea houses in the area, so I would certainly stay away from this one (especially given their mediocre drinks/ deserts).
author: Rahim D.

description: this place is A-OK. come here every now n then and get a flavored milk tea, so far nothing extraordinary but its a chill spot late at night especially during weekdays, their popcorn chicken is pretty good too. nothing memorable but id go back.
author: Phill E.

description: Pretty decent place. Went in because they just opened and cups resembled Purple Kow, so why not give it a try? Servers were ok but the wait was quite long. Place is more of a take out place than to sit in since its kind of squished. Tea was pretty good, I got the Honey Green Milk Tea with boba. it was almost $4? Kinda pricey but better than quickly's or teaway. I heard the yogurt slush drinks and matcha tea were bad though. They also sell caramel machiatto, I probably would just stick to starbuck's if I want one though. As for honey B, if u want the best tasting drinks, I'd advise the honey teas. Probably would come back again to try others, but probably not going to be a daily customer. PRetty close to Pho`Garden so who knows maybe I'll drop by whenever I want Pho` (: LOL ok.
author: Stephanie D.

description:
Our initial visit was good, so we decided to come back.

I ordered Honey & Grass Jelly, and added aloe vera for another $0.50. When I got my drink, there was no aloe vera.

My wife ordered Hot Grass Jelly with boba and taro.  The taro was barely noticeable.

Overall, the drinks are better than Quickly, which was what it was before Honey-B took over. Still, we will probably not go back because of our recent experience.
author: Chien C.

description: The price is very good, the size of the drink is very big and delicious. I don't understand why yelp put 2 $$ on them, but actually their menu is very cheap. Have wifi, accept credit card and clean, I definitely will go back there again.
author: Patrick W.

description: The servers are really nice and so is the place. Drinks are the size of purple kows. I guess it's decent if you get the teas instead of their slushes because the slushes taste really bad. Teas are pretty good and I would go back for the honey milk green tea. One of my favorites.
author: Ashley S.

description:
This place is another one of those new "hang out places" with pretty decor and a place to sit and talk. The menu was pretty simple, more tea than milk tea. With all the new boba places that's opening, no flavored milk tea just isn't going to cut it. 

I order the regular milk tea with boba. The boba was good. The milk tea on the other wasn't. It was pretty watered down, so there wasn't a tea or a milk taste to it. My friend also ordered the same thing and she said her's was tasteless too. I don't know if they made it together and they didn't add the tea/milk portions right or what. But with all the new non-powered-based drink stores recently, this place just wasn't good enough. 

The customer service was really friendly and nice though.
author: Jackie L.

description: Reasonably priced. I had honey dew milk boba tea and it was okay. Nothing stood out to me. Huge drink just for around $4. Huge menu. They do not charge extra for boba. I don't mind trying out again would be nice to be able to have flavorful boba and adjustable sweetness levels.
author: Su R.

description: comparable to purple kow!! just without the wait! i was told by my brothers gf that it was. after a visit at my nieces, my boyfriend and i drove all the way to the city to try this place. i must say! my boyfriend was right. he said "ITS LIKE PURPLE KOW WITHOUT THE WAIT" haha but i know i know. no business like to compare with another. but i really like this place because we can have it sweeter or less sweet. and the workers were nice. they also close at 11! which is good because lots of places closes at 10. i ordered number 50, the ice milk with honey boba and grass jelly, while my boyfriend ordered number 12, the kiwi green tea with pineapple jelly. i also ordered togo for my brother and he texted me that was was GOOOD! will be coming back more
author: Winnie C.

description: their food and drinks are kinda expensive then Quickly's and Honeyberry but they make their eggpuffs very crunchy then Quickly.
author: Kimby Navasca Jomok L.

description: This location used to be a Quickly, but Honey B is much better.  Their tea are huge and have a lot more flavor and selection.  Their boba and jelly also taste a lot better.  Haven't seen them too crowded but I usually go on a weekend afternoon.  They also offer snacks on their menu.  Friendly staff and they are usually pretty quick with their service, considering there's only 1 cashier/bartender.
author: Ill C.

description: Not the judge or a juror just a foodie.I wanted some hot wings and wanted to go to a spot up the block from this jaunt but it was closed ....when all was almost lost I spy from the corner of my left eye this tea house, we pullover I walk in .....quaint.....a tea house for sure, I was almost afraid when all the present employees walked up on me, like I was North Korean and wandered across the border....but they were so nice and I got not 1 but 2 orders of their little wings yes 10 wings $10. ......Well worth the dimes spent... they had a little odd flavor but very tasty my husband liked them somewhat but said they had a odd after taste.... they were good to me....sometimes the simple things can pack a cute little punch......they get 3 stars because I remember exactly how those wings tasted so they are memorable...as far as the tea goes.....I can't say, but if you want a tasty little tidbit of goodness try the food... though it's not their signature it's pleasing to the pallet.
author: Robyn L.

description: Tasty iced milk drink w/egg pudding & honey boba. Sometimes during week nights the pearls are too soft. They ran out of the large pearls on a Sunday afternoon.
author: Starla L.

description: The boba and drink were good, but there was only one person making the drinks, so it took about 25 minutes (and the place wasn't even crowded!) Definitely not going here unless I'm planning on socializing and sitting down.
author: Boby B.

description: I rate this a 3.5, higher than purple know. The drinks offered taste better than the diluted flavors from purple kow. Quality of snacks depend on who's making them.
author: Michelle K.

description: Went here last night for some much needed boba fix. Im pregnant so I am not able to drink any tea and was wanting to get a honeydew smoothie when I saw on their menu a Taiwan iced milk drink. Since it didn't have tea in it, I was excited to try it as I really miss having tea so this would be as close to it as I can get. I got the honey kind and it was a bit sweet but it was still delicious! My husband got the honeydew smoothie and it didn't taste as good. I believe they use the powder kind to mix. Hubby said it was too creamy for his liking. Boba was sweet and chewy and would definitely come back for what I got and once I'm not pregnant,  I'll try the others!
author: trina g.

description: I got the iced milk drink with tapioca. The tapioca was inconsistent. Some were very mushy and others were chewy. The drink itself was a little too sweet especially the first sip even after mixing it. Not sure if I'd go back but would definitely as for the drink to be less sweet if I do.
author: Amelia L.

description:
30 minute wait for a quick drink 
what the heck... 
there was one person working both the front and back.
the skinny kid with braces had no idea how to work there.
he just kept taking order after order without going to make the orders.

ordered taro milk tea with the "honey boba"
at least they didn't put the artificial purple stuff in it.
there were actual bits of taro in the drink.
author: Candy Y.

description: This place is growing on me and I don't know why! I haven't tried their milk tea yet but just sipping on their tea creams. Or cream teas, I forgot what it's called...but this place is worth a try.
author: C. C.

description: Came here with my daughters after dinner for some dessert drinks.  This is the next best thing after Purple Kow opened. Similar sizes to purple kow, NO LONG wait in line!!  price is about the same. But I fell in love with the Honey tomato drink. Whew, it tastes refreshing with a hint if lemon.  It looks kinda kool too after they made it, it had swirls in it. If you like tomato juice or bloody mary, this is similar but with no alky in it!  We also tried the matcha green milk tea-it does have a very good tea taste but the milk overpowers it just a tiny bit. We asked for those jelly balls filled with mango flavor (similar to those orange eggs that you eat when you have sushi but this one is bigger), those were fun to pop in the mouth and tasted pretty good. Their milk tea here is way better than tea way or quickly. Purple kow, eehhh, I'd rather come here cuz you can actually taste the tea more than other places. Great service too, cuz it was our first time there, we were taking a long time to decide what to try. The cashier didn't rush us or give us any dirty look. She also suggested a few drinks too.  Will definitely come back!!
author: Alyce l.

description: Honestly this is even better than Purple Kow! My favorite is grass jelly mixed red beans with honey boba, the best ever! Never get it enough. It's a cozy place for hangout and chilleaxing. Don't miss out the yumminess!
author: Lucy H.

description: The milk tea with pearls here is yummy, comparable to purple kow, minus the wait.
author: abby q.

description: I tried the iced milk with grass jelly and honey boba. It is basically caramel syrup mixed with regular milk. I could still see the caramel syrup smeared on the side of the cup, and I had to mixed it in myself. Definitely cannot compared with Purple Kow, because I dumped it after drinking half of it. I craved for Purple Kow's iced milk, but Honey B obviously killed my craving with half a drink. Also, Purple Kow is very good in giving customers stamp cards and free super size with the free drink. Honey B staff didn't even informed me about the card, I just found out here in Yelp. When you implement a promotional campaign, you better stick to it and be honest about it. Otherwise, don't do it at all.
author: Daniel C.

description: This place and Purple Kow are pretty close to each other and I believe that Honey B was trying to copy what Purple Kow did. Did they succeed? Sort of. Purple Kow's milk tea is better than this place. However, the iced milk drinks here taste exactly the same as Purple Kow's. The prices here are slightly higher than Purple Kow's. Their tapoica balls aren't as good as Purple Kow's, but still very tasty. They have the same cup sizes as Purple Kow. I usually come here when the line for Purple Kow is too long.
author: Tracy C.

description: I'm basing this four star review off the milk tea with boba, which was delicious. The boba was soft and fresh. My mother had some orange yogurt drink and it tasted like perfume. Maybe it had jasmine or something in it, but it was nasty. They also don't have Thai tea for some reason. I thought that was a simple staple at tea houses, but I guess not. It also looked like they had three or four rinsed blenders, for those who had concerns about the lack of materials. Service was fast, but there was also no one in line. The cups are awkwardly shaped: short and fat, reminiscent of a noodle bowl rather than a tea bowl. It's weird to carry it in one hand and I felt like I was going to drop it because I don't have massive hands. I'll probably be back here since it's super close to my apartment and the prices are reasonable. I don't know if they have a stamp card thing going on, but they should get one.
author: k h.

description: who own this place?  and why did you leave kids to run this place without any training?  we went into get 1 simple milk tea boba.  simple right? there are 3 workers in the back chatting with the cashier. they saw us come in and are ready to order but kept chatting.  they finally take our order and we see that there's one other couple in the whole place.  after 10 mins, we were wondering where our 1 milk tea was. walked to see all 4 of the workers back there running around and we were wondering what they were making.  another 5 mins and we see them bring 4 simple milk tea, green tea, etc boba for the couple.  are they picking the tea and milking the cow back there?  and we still don't have our simple boba milk tea.  are they serious?  what are they doing?  i can't imagine how long if it was busy.  man BAMBU 2 blocks away is way more busy and they are quicker than them.  yeah, we aren't coming back.  not just that they are slow but the drink was watery.  why ask if i wanted less sweet, regular sweet or extra sweet if you aren't going to listen?
author: Silver C.
